-KtXpA9MtM7_EMcBZZL-.description:
• Yesterday, Republicans were shocked when President Trump sided with Democrats and agreed to support a 3-month deal that will increase the debt ceiling and pass a temporary budget.
  • Trump supported this bill because if it passes Congress, it guarantees the first installment of Hurricane Harvey relief funds ($7.85B).
  • Democrats and Republicans disagreed over how much the debt ceiling should be increased.
  • Democrats wanted a smaller increase that would fund the government until December. This would give them another opportunity to aggressively negotiate for funding for their agenda when debt ceiling talks start again.
  • Republicans wanted a larger debt ceiling increase so that they wouldn't have to revisit debt ceiling negotiations in December — they preferred to approve an increase that would fund the government until after the 2018 midterm elections.
-KtXpA9MtM7_EMcBZZL-.foodForThought: Is this a sign of more bi-partisanship to come? Is the GOP right to be frustrated? Is it OK for a minority party to play political brinkmanship with debt ceiling negotiations?
-KtXpA9MtM7_EMcBZZL-.name: Trump's Debt Ceiling Deal with the Democrats

-KtXrJ_CecxXSfGml22J.description: The most talked about trade of the NBA offseason occurred on Tuesday. The Cleveland Cavaliers sent Kyrie Irving to the Boston Celtics and in return, the Celtics sent Isaiah Thomas, Jae Crowder, Ante Zizic and Brooklyn's 2018 first-round pick to the Cavs.
-KtXrJ_CecxXSfGml22J.name: The NBA's Irving / Thomas Trade

-Ku0qDJmVLYXMFa9L9I3.description:
• A group of conservative Christian leaders wrote a doctrinal statement expressing their beliefs on human sexuality and voicing their disapproval of same-sex marriage and the gender-fluidity movement.
  • Since its release, some have praised the statement for its clarity, and others denounced it as harmful to the LGBT community.
-Ku0qDJmVLYXMFa9L9I3.foodForThought: How should we define 'tolerance' and 'doctrine'? Does either definition leave room for nuance?
-Ku0qDJmVLYXMFa9L9I3.name: The Nashville Statement

-Ku1Vy4DYNBL818mQydt.description:
• On Tuesday, Apple announced it's 10th anniversary iPhone, the iPhone X.
  • The new phone costs $999, but it includes an all-glass screen (and no home button), facial recognition technology and wireless charging.
-Ku1Vy4DYNBL818mQydt.foodForThought: Is the iPhone X worth the hype and the price?
-Ku1Vy4DYNBL818mQydt.name: Apple's New iPhone X

-KuBDnN77DtjVPYGyc9T.description:
• North Korea claims that it tested a hydrogen bomb over the weekend.
  • This is big news because hydrogen bombs are up to 1000X more powerful than simple atomic bombs (like the ones dropped in Japan).
-KuBDnN77DtjVPYGyc9T.foodForThought: At this point, what should the US do to deter the North Korean threat?
-KuBDnN77DtjVPYGyc9T.name: How to Respond to North Korea
-KuBDnN77DtjVPYGyc9T.shortTitle: How to Respond to North Korea

-KuBHphjouBzk1hfNIsj.description:
• At Abridge News, we strongly believe that all Americans — regardless of their political views — are good.
  • It's been inspiring for us to see stories of hope amidst the tragedy of Hurricane Harvey.
  • Today, we want to share some of these stories. When hard times hit, party lines don't matter. Good-hearted people do.
-KuBHphjouBzk1hfNIsj.foodForThought: Think of somebody who has political views that you strongly disagree with... If you were in a crisis, would this person help you out? What if the roles were reversed?
-KuBHphjouBzk1hfNIsj.name: Moments of Hope During Hurricane Harvey

-KuBPcS9soJZObrept4J.description:
• Earlier this week, President Trump and Attorney General Sessions announced an executive order that lifts restrictions on the transfer of surplus military-style equipment to the police.
  • Sessions said that this order aims to enhance public safety and will provide police with things like bullet-proof helmets, and armored vehicles.
-KuBPcS9soJZObrept4J.foodForThought: Will this Executive Order improve public safety? Or will it simply increase tensions between police and local communities?
-KuBPcS9soJZObrept4J.name: Military Gear for Police

-KuFQQ0n2G1I-h4jmgqQ.description:
• Over the past month, Myanmar (a majority-Buddhist country formerly known as Burma) has been systematically killing civilians who belong to the Muslim Rohingya minority.
  • 270,000 Rohingya have fled to Myanmar's neighboring country, Bangladesh. 
  • The current leader of Myanmar, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, is a modern hero who suffered 15 years of house arrest and led Myanmar's campaign for democracy. She won the Nobel Peace Prize for her efforts.
  • However, today, many people are wondering why Daw Suu downplays the Rohingya crisis in her country.
-KuFQQ0n2G1I-h4jmgqQ.foodForThought: Is the world paying enough attention to this humanitarian crisis? Should Aung San Suu Kyi be stripped of her Nobel Peace Prize?
-KuFQQ0n2G1I-h4jmgqQ.mobile_img_attr: DFID - UK Department for International Development
-KuFQQ0n2G1I-h4jmgqQ.name: The Rohingya Crisis in Myanmar

-KuFV0dx9_9uU9uovCpl.description:
• On Sunday, Uber's board selected Dara Khosrowshahi, the longtime CEO of Expedia, to serve as Uber's new CEO.
  • Khosrowshahi replaces Uber's founder, Travis Kalanick, and was selected over other CEO contenders such as HP's Meg Whitman and GE's Jeff Immelt.
  • Khosrowshahi must immediately help Uber recover from a tumultuous 2017 that was headlined by internal dissension, executive departures, and charges of sexual harassment.
-KuFV0dx9_9uU9uovCpl.foodForThought: Is Dara Khosrowshahi a good pick for CEO? If you were offered the Uber job, would you take it?
-KuFV0dx9_9uU9uovCpl.name: Uber's New CEO

-KuNL6EbK4Out3_b0F3C.description:
• The 2017 Emmy Awards were held last Sunday evening.
  • "The Handmaid's Tale", "Big Little Lies, "SNL" and "Veep" were some of the big winners.
  • However, most people were talking about the political nature of the show which included a surprise appearance from former White House Press Secretary, Sean Spicer.
-KuNL6EbK4Out3_b0F3C.foodForThought: How much should our current political climate be reflected in entertainment and pop culture?
-KuNL6EbK4Out3_b0F3C.name: The 2017 Emmy Awards

-KuSMb3hM6wnW1gBGcXs.description:
• On Tuesday, President Trump gave a speech to the UN General Assembly, a group comprised of leaders from nearly 200 countries.
  • In his speech, Trump strongly defended America's national sovereignty, including a promise to "totally destroy" if North Korea attacked.
  • Additionally, he stated that America carries a disproportionate burden for the UN budget.
-KuSMb3hM6wnW1gBGcXs.foodForThought: Did President Trump give the right speech at the right time?
-KuSMb3hM6wnW1gBGcXs.img_attr: By Patrick Gruban, cropped and downsampled by Pine [CC BY-SA 2.0]
-KuSMb3hM6wnW1gBGcXs.name: President Trump's UN Speech

-KuX6MUMw5sJIpSpoFsq.description:
• President Trump is reportedly close to striking an immigration deal with congressional Democrats (like Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi).
  • The deal would protect the Dreamers in exchange for a "massive" border security upgrade. However, this deal likely will not include funding for the border wall.
-KuX6MUMw5sJIpSpoFsq.foodForThought: Is Trump betraying his base through this deal? Or would this represent a huge political victory and a step towards bi-partisanship?
-KuX6MUMw5sJIpSpoFsq.name: President Trump's DACA Decision (part 2)

-KuX7yelQcE5a5asvNbZ.description:
• On Tuesday morning, Hillary Clinton's new book, titled "What Happened" will hit bookstores.
  • The book provides her take on the 2016 election and its aftermath.
  • The reviews of the book have been mixed (with many questioning her choice to write the book in the first place).
-KuX7yelQcE5a5asvNbZ.foodForThought: Will Hillary's memoir help her supporters get closure on the 2016 election, or will it deepen divisions by casting blame?
-KuX7yelQcE5a5asvNbZ.img_attr: By United States Department of State
-KuX7yelQcE5a5asvNbZ.name: Hillary Clinton's New Book

-KuX9dMJ1cXXJ_l9foyV.description:
• Yesterday, President Trump ended the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program.
  • This program, which was created through an Obama executive order, allowed ~800,000 undocumented immigrants who were brought to the US as children to temporarily stay in the US to work or study.
  • President Trump claims that DACA is unconstitutional because immigration law is the responsibility of Congress, not the Executive Branch.
  • Trump has given Congress 6 months to come up with a DACA replacement before the program officially ends
-KuX9dMJ1cXXJ_l9foyV.foodForThought: Did President Trump make the right decision, or was it cruel? Was Obama's acting in a constitutional manner when he put DACA in place?
-KuX9dMJ1cXXJ_l9foyV.name: President Trump's DACA Decision

-KuXaqM-DXbycaLQB7Cz.description:
• Facebook has come under fire for its targeted advertising practices.
  • The company recently disclosed that Russia bought $100,000 in advertising on its platform during the 2016 election season and generated thousands of ads through fake accounts.
  • Then, ProPublica reported that Facebook's ads allowed businesses to target repugnant groups, for instance, those that self-classified as 'Jew-haters'.
  • Currently, Facebook is valued at ~$500B and the cornerstone of its business model is its targeted advertising.
-KuXaqM-DXbycaLQB7Cz.foodForThought: Can Facebook address concerns over its targeted advertising policies without fundamentally changing its business model?
-KuXaqM-DXbycaLQB7Cz.name: Facebook's Targeted Advertising Policies

-KubMAz9cSAYhLNUbW-v.description:
• Last Friday, Hurricane Harvey slammed Texas as a Category 4 storm. Houston experienced severe flooding, with thousands stranded, nearly 2 feet of rain, and at least 8 dead.
  • The flooding is expected to get worse over the next few days as the rains continue.
-KubMAz9cSAYhLNUbW-v.foodForThought: Is it fair for either party to politicize a storm like Harvey? Did climate change play a role in the catastrophe? How can we help those suffering in Texas?
-KubMAz9cSAYhLNUbW-v.name: Hurricane Harvey

-KubR55xgybIa88Qr6WV.description:
• During a rally in Arizona, President Trump promised to veto any budget that doesn't include funding for a wall along the US / Mexico border.
  • If the President and Congressmembers (from both parties) don't reach an agreement, this could lead to a Government shutdown.
-KubR55xgybIa88Qr6WV.foodForThought: Which party would deserve blame if a government shutdown occurs? How much blame would fall on the President? Is a shutdown as drastic as it sounds?
-KubR55xgybIa88Qr6WV.name: A Government Shutdown over the Border Wall?
-KubR55xgybIa88Qr6WV.shortTitle: A Shutdown Over the Border Wall?

-KubWGKzJPaksb84c-gw.description:
• The most talked about trade of the NBA offseason occurred on Tuesday.
  • The Cleveland Cavaliers sent Kyrie Irving to the Boston Celtics and in return, the Celtics sent Isaiah Thomas, Jae Crowder, Ante Zizic and Brooklyn's 2018 first-round pick to the Cavs.
-KubWGKzJPaksb84c-gw.foodForThought: Who got the better end of the deal? Will the deal enable either team to compete with the Golden State Warriors?
-KubWGKzJPaksb84c-gw.name: The NBA's Irving / Thomas Trade

-Kue2xoOc8dblGaHXoz-.description:
• On Monday evening, President Trump announced his strategy for the 16-year old Afghanistan War. His strategy includes the following components

1) Increased US troop levels (but no exact number was announced)

2) Greater military autonomy and fewer restrictions on offensive operations

3) No timeline for US troop withdrawals

4) More pressure on Pakistan (with aid potentially cut-off) and a stronger strategic partnership with India

5) Winning, not nation-building. Winning was defined as, "attacking our enemies, obliterating ISIS, crushing al Qaeda, preventing the Taliban from taking over Afghanistan and stopping mass terror attacks against America before they emerge."
-Kue2xoOc8dblGaHXoz-.foodForThought: Is President Trump's strategy the right one? Is it really different from that of former President Obama?
-Kue2xoOc8dblGaHXoz-.name: President Trump's Afghanistan Strategy

-Kue4A7wxnmRTsozwyit.description:
• Early Monday morning, the USS John S. McCain collided with an oil tanker near Singapore. 10 sailors are still missing.
  • This marks the fourth US Naval incident this year. Yesterday, the Navy announced that it would pause all of its global operations for a day.
-Kue4A7wxnmRTsozwyit.foodForThought: What is leading to these incidents? Are they true accidents, the result of inadequate funding, overcrowded shipping lanes, or something else?
-Kue4A7wxnmRTsozwyit.name: Recent U.S. Navy Collisions

-Kue5OLFjSla2ZZLGOJm.description:
• On Friday, President Trump dismissed his chief strategist, Steve Bannon.
  • Bannon was one of the architects of the President's election victory and champions of a nationalist agenda.
  • Bannon is back atop Breitbart News and said he is planning to go "to war for Trump against his opponents."
-Kue5OLFjSla2ZZLGOJm.foodForThought: Is Bannon's firing significant? Will he be more or less influential outside of the White House?
-Kue5OLFjSla2ZZLGOJm.img_attr: By Gage Skidmore from Peoria, AZ
-Kue5OLFjSla2ZZLGOJm.name: The Ouster of Steve Bannon

-Kue7kueRJpGneQZtBqh.description: • On Monday, a total solar eclipse will occur across the entire continental US for the first time in 99 years.
-Kue7kueRJpGneQZtBqh.foodForThought: Does the event deserving the hype it's getting?
-Kue7kueRJpGneQZtBqh.name: The Solar Eclipse

-Kuf0uCdTBi1oaxwgnR2.description: • Protests are becoming more frequent, more passionate, and at times, more controversial.
-Kuf0uCdTBi1oaxwgnR2.foodForThought: Are protests effective? Or are they counter-productive? Why do people protest in the first place?
-Kuf0uCdTBi1oaxwgnR2.name: Protests in America

-Kuf37ZvpM-ipBCmUrQE.description:
• Yesterday, President Donald Trump continued his critique of Amazon and Amazon's leader, Jeff Bezos.
  • The President tweeted that "Amazon is doing great damage to tax-paying retailers. Towns, cities and states throughout the U.S. are being hurt - many jobs being lost!".
-Kuf37ZvpM-ipBCmUrQE.foodForThought: Is the President right, wrong, or is it more nuanced?
-Kuf37ZvpM-ipBCmUrQE.name: Amazon and the Retail Industry

-Kuf7PlTTQD-dOzGM6uD.description:
• Yesterday, President Trump condemned white supremacist groups for their violent protests in Charlottesville, VA.
  • But initially, President Trump denounced the violence on "many sides".
-Kuf7PlTTQD-dOzGM6uD.foodForThought: Did President Trump act in a Presidential manner? Or is his response being unfairly characterized?
-Kuf7PlTTQD-dOzGM6uD.name: President Trump's Response to Charlottesville

-Kuf9100hqiRevUVvB09.description:
• On Saturday, white nationalists scheduled a rally in Charlottesville, VA to protest the removal of a statue of General Robert E. Lee, a famous Confederate leader.
  • The white nationalists were met by counter-protesters and the situation spiraled into violence. A car rammed into a crowd of the counter-protesters, killing one woman and injuring dozens. Two police officers dies in a helicopter crash while helping to clear the streets.
-Kuf9100hqiRevUVvB09.foodForThought: Was the city of Charlottesville justified in its decision to remove the statue of General Robert E. Lee?
-Kuf9100hqiRevUVvB09.name: The Status of Confederate Monuments

-KufB8kwftSj06an7Hz_.description:
• A year ago, Colin Kaepernick — the San Francisco 49ers' injured quarterback — began sitting during the national anthem at NFL games.
  • He justified his action by saying he was "not going to stand up and show pride in a flag for a country that oppresses black people and people of color". His protest generated tons of backlash and support. 
  • Today, one month away from another NFL season, Kaepernick is out of a job. Some say he is being blackballed by the NFL while others say that he is a mediocre player that carries too much baggage.
-KufB8kwftSj06an7Hz_.foodForThought: Would you hire Kaepernick if you were an NFL owner?
-KufB8kwftSj06an7Hz_.name: Unemployment for Colin Kaepernick

-Kujl7J0M3k_o-yDaklk.description:
• After the UN unanimously agreed to pass harsh sanctions on North Korea, North Korea vowed to 'make the US pay dearly'.
  • President Trump responded by warning North Korea of 'fire and fury like the world has never seen' if they continue to threaten the US.
  • Then, North Korea threatened to attack the US territory of Guam.
  • And yesterday, Secretary of State, Rex Tillerson, defended President Trump's comments and said that there was "no sign that the threat level from North Korea had changed".
-Kujl7J0M3k_o-yDaklk.foodForThought: Was the President's comment dangerous, or was it smart foreign policy?
-Kujl7J0M3k_o-yDaklk.name: President Trump's "Fire and Fury" Comment

-KujrbA7nfYrASg4BI1o.description:
• Last weekend, a male software engineer at Google wrote an internal memo that criticized the company's diversity initiatives.
  • The memo says that Google should focus on 'ideological diversity' instead of gender and racial diversity and it states that 'genetic differences' explain why there aren't more women in tech leadership roles.
  • The memo generated tons of backlash, support and debate — particularly after the engineer was fired.
  • The attention on this situation at Google is also amplified because the company is currently under an investigation by the US Department of Labor for paying women less than men.
-KujrbA7nfYrASg4BI1o.foodForThought: Was Google right to fire the software engineer? How should businesses balance free speech and company culture?
-KujrbA7nfYrASg4BI1o.name: Google's Controversial Memo

-Kuqp-wNh2Kzp1i9534a.description:
• At a campaign rally for Sen. Luther Strange in Alabama on Friday night, President Trump criticized the NFL and NFL players for protesting during the National Anthem.
  • President Trump said, “Wouldn’t you love to see one of these NFL owners, when somebody disrespects our flag, to say, ‘Get that son of a b**** off the field right now. Out! He’s fired. He’s fired!’”
  • In response, on Sunday, around 100 NFL players silently protested President Trump's comments by kneeling during the National Anthem. Other players didn't kneel, but still opted for a display of unity and locked arms with their teammates.
-Kuqp-wNh2Kzp1i9534a.foodForThought: Would you stand, lock arms, or kneel during the National Anthem if you were an NFL player?
-Kuqp-wNh2Kzp1i9534a.name: The NFL's National Anthem Protests

-Kuw-yrC6dvqs_T2Uvu4.description:
• Last week, Republicans proposed another repeal and replace bill, called Graham-Cassidy. This bill proposed shifting healthcare decisions to states.
  • However, it doesn't appear to have enough support to pass after Sen. John McCain, Sen. Susan Collins and Sen. Rand Paul announced their "no" votes. 
  • Meanwhile, Democratic Senator Bernie Sanders has proposed his own bill called Medicare for All. Sanders' proposal has been endorsed by 15 Democratic senators. 
  • On Monday evening, CNN hosted a healthcare debate between Republican Sen. Graham and Sen. Cassidy and Democratic Sen. Sanders.
-Kuw-yrC6dvqs_T2Uvu4.foodForThought: Would a single-payer system work in America? What are the political ramifications of Sanders' bill for the Democrats?
-Kuw-yrC6dvqs_T2Uvu4.name: Senator Sanders' Single-Payer Healthcare Plan

-Kv2r2PrhgH_2KjBVHgu.description:
• The US territory of Puerto Rico is reeling after Hurricane Maria. In addition to devastating storm damage, the island is dealing with a crippling debt crisis.
  • People are debating how to most effectively help the island recover, but they are also talking about President Trump's recent tweets about the island.
  • President Trump tweeted, "Texas & Florida are doing great but Puerto Rico, which was already suffering from broken infrastructure & massive debt, is in deep trouble. It's old electrical grid, which was in terrible shape, was devastated. Much of the Island was destroyed, with billions of dollars owed to Wall Street and the banks which, sadly, must be dealt with. Food, water and medical are top priorities - and doing well."
-Kv2r2PrhgH_2KjBVHgu.foodForThought: How can the U.S. best help Puerto Rico? Is the federal response being judged too quickly?
-Kv2r2PrhgH_2KjBVHgu.name: Puerto Rico's Storm and Debt Crises
-Kv2r2PrhgH_2KjBVHgu.shortTitle: Puerto Rico's Storm and Debt Crises

-KvEHo2T06dAJHOYb8SG.description:
• On Wednesday, President Trump and the GOP proposed a plan that would cut taxes for companies and individuals by nearly $6 trillion.
  • The plan calls for simplifying the tax code by reducing the number of tax brackets and deductions. The details for this proposal (including how it will be funded) are still in the works.
-KvEHo2T06dAJHOYb8SG.foodForThought: ﻿How much economic growth would be generated by these tax cuts? Who are the winners and losers in this plan?
-KvEHo2T06dAJHOYb8SG.name: GOP Tax Reform

-KvU6jiisk9Q_pZ2T6kH.description:
• Last evening, at a Jason Aldean concert outside the Mandalay Bay Resort in Las Vegas, 58 people were killed and 500+ were injured in a mass shooting.
  • The main suspect in the shooting, 64-year old Stephen Paddock, fired shots from his 32nd floor hotel room before killing himself.
-KvU6jiisk9Q_pZ2T6kH.foodForThought: ﻿How should Americans honor the massacre victims? How can America prevent attacks like this in the future? Should we have conversations about both questions simultaneously?
-KvU6jiisk9Q_pZ2T6kH.name: The Las Vegas Massacre

-Kvbv9EDIzhwjlzYXwml.description:
• This week, the Supreme Court heard oral arguments for a gerrymandering case, Gill v. Whitford, that many think could reshape US politics.
  • The case arose from Republican redistricting efforts in Wisconsin in 2010. The plaintiffs argue that the GOP's method for drawing the electoral map created partisan advantages and skewed results for Republicans.
  •  Now, the Supreme Court must decide whether the Wisconsin re-districting was extreme enough to be deemed "unconstitutional".
  • Justice Kennedy's swing vote will likely determine the outcome of the court case. The court has until June to make its decision.
-Kvbv9EDIzhwjlzYXwml.foodForThought: What will the Supreme Court's decision mean for American politics? Is there any principled way for the Court to decide how much partisan redistricting is too much?
-Kvbv9EDIzhwjlzYXwml.name: Partisan Gerrymandering and the Supreme Court

-KvnAgiJU04EgaCwEY43.description:
• Carolina Panthers' Quarterback, Cam Newton, is in hot water after making what was perceived as a sexist comment towards Charlotte Observer sports reporter, Jourdan Rodrigue.
  • Newton responded to one of Rodrigue's post-game questions by saying, "It's funny to hear a female talk about routes".
  • A media firestorm ensued. Newton was widely criticized, lost his sponsorship with Dannon Yogurt, and has since issued an apology.
  • Meanwhile, Black Sports Online uncovered 4-5 year old racist tweets from Rodrigue, so she has also issued her own apology.
-KvnAgiJU04EgaCwEY43.foodForThought: The interaction between Newton and Rodrigue is all over national news. Is this worthy of so much conversation, or is it just emblematic of America's outrage-culture?
-KvnAgiJU04EgaCwEY43.name: Cam Newton's Sexism Controversy

-Kw0rpfGqf9OCsfcYiOF.description:
• This week, the people of Catalonia voted to secede from Spain.
  • For many years, Catalans have been seeking independence. Their drive for self-determination stems largely from their unique culture & language.
  • Violence between protesters and police broke out in the aftermath of the vote.
  • Later this week, a Spanish court ruled that Catalonia’s Parliament could not approve the decision to separate. Such a decision, the court ruled, would violate the constitutional rights of Catalonia’s Members of Parliament.
-Kw0rpfGqf9OCsfcYiOF.name: Catalonia's Independence Referendum

-Kw7AeT_bmebDY_NkZmt.description:
• In 2015, Obama signed the Clean Power Plan, a regulation that required power plants to cap their carbon emissions.
  • On Monday, E.P.A. Administrator Scott Pruitt announced that the Trump Administration will take formal steps to repeal the regulation and stated that "the war on coal is over".
  • Over the next few months, the proposed repeal will go through a formal public-comment period and the E.P.A. will likely begin designing a replacement rule.
-Kw7AeT_bmebDY_NkZmt.foodForThought:
How should we evaluate the costs and benefits of the Clean Power Plan? 

Does the Clean Power Plan fall within the EPA's jurisdiction?
-Kw7AeT_bmebDY_NkZmt.name: The EPA's Proposed Repeal of the Clean Power Plan

-KwH7MDnN_w0fHNkGcMg.description:
• Harvey Weinstein, the producer of hits such as Pulp Fiction, Good Will Hunting and Shakespeare in Love, is a Hollywood legend. However, last Thursday, the New York Times broke a story claiming that Weinstein has a long history of sexually abusing women.
  • Since the report, over 20 public allegations have been made against Weinstein. Many people claim that his predatory behavior has been an open secret for years.
  • Weinstein is a also prominent donor for the Democratic party. He donated hundreds of thousands to President Obama's campaign, was invited to the Obama White House 13 times, and has hosted multiple fundraising events for the Clintons.
-KwH7MDnN_w0fHNkGcMg.foodForThought:
How do people like Weinstein get away with chronic sexual assault?

Are liberals doing enough to condemn Weinstein's behavior or are they acting in a hypocritical manner?
-KwH7MDnN_w0fHNkGcMg.img_attr: David Shankbone - Own Work, CC by 3.0
-KwH7MDnN_w0fHNkGcMg.name: The Harvey Weinstein Scandal

-KwMnJQZ_w5rPJ7Tn15u.description:
• Wildfires are raging across California.
  • Thousands of buildings and homes have been destroyed and 31 people have been confirmed dead, many of whom are elderly.
  • Firefighters are making some progress to control the devastating fires, but as of this Friday morning, over 15 fires were still un-contained.
-KwMnJQZ_w5rPJ7Tn15u.foodForThought: What are the primary wildfire causes? What changes should we make to reduce future wildfire devastation?
-KwMnJQZ_w5rPJ7Tn15u.name: The California Wildfires

-KwabHq0CGW91II4O2Dl.description:
• Last week, President Trump decertified the Iran nuclear agreement.
  • The deal, passed in 2015 under the Obama administration, lifted heavy sanctions against Iran. In exchange for sanctions relief, Iran agreed to halt its nuclear weapons program.
  • President Trump's decertification doesn't mean that the US is immediately pulling out of the agreement. However, it does mean that Congress now has 60 days to decide how to best proceed with the Iran deal.
-KwabHq0CGW91II4O2Dl.foodForThought: Should Congress keep the deal as-is, re-impose sanctions on Iran (effectively ending the deal), or attempt to renegotiate?
-KwabHq0CGW91II4O2Dl.name: The Iran Nuclear Deal

-KwjqcSTdQToyhnUz-A_.description:
• Last November, Cook County (home of Chicago) passed a $0.01 / ounce tax on soda.
  • The County Commissioners justified the tax by arguing that sodas pose a major public health threat. They planned to use the revenue from the tax to balance the county's budget.
  • Many other cities, including Philadelphia and Berkeley, have enacted similar soda taxes.
  • There was wide public backlash against the Cook County soda tax (lawsuits, retailers complaining about lost sales, etc.) and last week, the Cook County Board of Commissioners voted to repeal the tax.
-KwjqcSTdQToyhnUz-A_.foodForThought: Did the Cook County Board of Commissioners make the right decision when it repealed Chicago's tax on sodas?
-KwjqcSTdQToyhnUz-A_.name: Chicago's Soda Tax

-KwrEzX-cAo4bIAolqEi.description:
• Amazon caused a stir when it asked local governments to submit bids for its second headquarters (HQ2).
  • The company promised to bring $5B+ in investment and up to 50,000 high-paying jobs to the winning city. Today was the last day for local governments to submit bids.
  • Some cities refused to bid at all, some offered fairly modest proposals, but others went all-out and offered billions of dollars in tax breaks, fee reductions and relocation grants. All bids were due today.
-KwrEzX-cAo4bIAolqEi.foodForThought:
Should cities try to lure Amazon with huge tax breaks?

What criteria should Amazon use when choosing a location for HQ2?
-KwrEzX-cAo4bIAolqEi.name: The Bidding War for Amazon's HQ2
-KwrEzX-cAo4bIAolqEi.shortTitle: The Bidding War for Amazon's HQ2

-Kx9dylJlBW6OcGHx0-i.description:
• Last week, Myeshia Johnson, the widow of a soldier killed in Niger, shared details from a condolence call that she received from President Trump.
  • She said that the President couldn't remember her husband's name. She added that Trump said that her husband "knew what he signed up for, but it hurts anyways".
  • The story spread when Congresswoman Frederica Wilson (D-Fl) defended Myeshia Johnson's version of events and said that she heard the entire call on speakerphone.
  • Then, White House Chief of Staff John Kelly, came to the President's defense. Kelly criticized Congresswoman Wilson for politicizing a soldier's death and recalled details from the death of his own son in Afghanistan.
-Kx9dylJlBW6OcGHx0-i.foodForThought:
Does the President deserve criticism for these condolence calls?

Is this an appropriate story for the media to cover?
-Kx9dylJlBW6OcGHx0-i.name: President Trump's Condolence Calls

-KxEpfBfcDeb1B7Gl3nX.description:
• Good news for baseball fans! The 113th World Series starts tonight when the Los Angeles Dodgers host the Houston Astros.
  • This is the Dodgers' first World Series appearance since 1988 and the Astros' first appearance since 2005. The winner of the best-of-seven series will be crowned champion.
-KxEpfBfcDeb1B7Gl3nX.foodForThought: Which team is more likely to win? Who will you cheer for?
-KxEpfBfcDeb1B7Gl3nX.name: 2017 World Series Predictions

-KxJwmobxpCnRzwlB-Ju.description:
• In late September residents of the Kurdistan section of Iraq voted to create an independent state. 
  • Since then, the Kurdistan Regional Government indicated it could use the milestone to begin state building negotiations and the Republic of Iraq advanced militarily on the City of Kirkuk.
  • While an independent Kurdish state seems off the table for the moment, its eventual creation could have major impacts on the stability of the Middle East.
-KxJwmobxpCnRzwlB-Ju.foodForThought: Should stability take precedence over the desire of a group of individuals to form their own nation-state?
-KxJwmobxpCnRzwlB-Ju.name: Kurdistan's Independence Vote

-KxOyDhMh7o61Srqzzsa.description:
• Sen. Jeff Flake (R-AZ) gave a speech on Tuesday announcing his retirement.
  • In his speech, he sharply criticized President Trump and bemoaned the state of American politics today.
  • At the time of his speech, Flake's approval ratings in his home state were low. Flake will serve out his current Senate term until January 2019.
-KxOyDhMh7o61Srqzzsa.foodForThought: What does Sen. Flake's retirement mean for the both political parties? Is he a Republican martyr or an opportunistic politician?
-KxOyDhMh7o61Srqzzsa.name: Sen. Jeff Flake's Retirement Speech

-KxSpYlirRQWnOtNAVy8.description:
• Earlier this week, news broke that Hillary Clinton's campaign and the Democratic National Committee (DNC) helped fund research into the notorious "dossier" on President Trump.
  • The dossier made strong character attacks against Trump and claimed that he had ties to Russian officials and solicited Russian prostitutes.
  • The Trump administration has firmly denied all allegations in the "dossier."
-KxSpYlirRQWnOtNAVy8.foodForThought: Should the funding of the Trump "dossier" by Clinton’s campaign and the DNC be viewed as a scandalous offense or just another day in campaign politics?
-KxSpYlirRQWnOtNAVy8.name: Clinton, the DNC and the Trump "Dossier"
-KxSpYlirRQWnOtNAVy8.shortTitle: Clinton, the DNC and the Trump "Dossier"

-Kxidu5uEB7qGeCfWJMl.description:
• In September, President Donald Trump laid out broad outlines for his plan to restructure significant parts of the U.S. tax code. 
  • Congressional Republicans have been working feverishly to turn this plan into a legislative proposal that can pass the U.S. Congress.
-Kxidu5uEB7qGeCfWJMl.foodForThought: Will the proposed GOP tax plan help or hinder economic growth? Who benefits from the plan?
-Kxidu5uEB7qGeCfWJMl.name: Revisiting the GOP's Tax Plan

-KxoGLjaq2jROoXCVU-D.description:
• Yesterday, Robert Mueller’s investigation into potential collusion between Russia and the Trump campaign issued criminal charges.
  • Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign manager, was served 12 counts including conspiracy, money laundering, and serving as a foreign agent for a pro-Russia political party in Ukraine.
  • Rick Gates, an associate of Manafort, was indicted for similar charges.
  • Finally, George Papadopoulos, one of Trump’s campaign advisors, pled guilty to lying to federal agents.
-KxoGLjaq2jROoXCVU-D.foodForThought: What are the implications of the recent indictments and court filings against Manafort, Gates and Papadopoulos?
-KxoGLjaq2jROoXCVU-D.name: Mueller’s Russia Investigation

-Ky6QIrgwO7sQxgM0f4_.description:
• Representatives from Facebook, Google and Twitter testified in three different hearings this week as congressional probes into Russian election influence continue.
  • At the hearings, the tech companies expressed contrition for the election meddling enabled by their sites and promised to do better through internal changes and new initiatives.
  • Meanwhile, a group of bi-partisan senators proposed a bill called the Honest Ads Act that would legally require additional transparency measures for online political ads.
-Ky6QIrgwO7sQxgM0f4_.foodForThought: Should the government impose more regulations on big tech companies like Facebook, Twitter and Google?
-Ky6QIrgwO7sQxgM0f4_.name: The Regulation of Online Political Ads

-Ky6UWZ6asUdS5INdsFs.description:
• On Tuesday afternoon in New York City, a 29-year-old man drove a truck into a crowded Manhattan bike lane, killing 8 and injuring more. 
  • The driver, later identified as Sayfullo Saipov, was charged Wednesday with federal terrorism offenses. 
  • Saipov, who immigrated from native Uzbekistan in 2010 and was living as a legal resident in New Jersey, has claimed ISIS was inspiration behind his deliberate deadly attack. 
  • In the wake of the most lethal act of terror committed in New York City since 9/11, President Trump has demanded extreme vetting measures be shored up, and the nation grapples with the question of how to best prevent future acts of terrorism.
-Ky6UWZ6asUdS5INdsFs.foodForThought: How should the United States and its citizens respond to terrorism? Should Tuesday’s attack influence broader policy decisions?
-Ky6UWZ6asUdS5INdsFs.name: New York City Terror Attack

-Ky6X_2roPcHhpMl5avb.description:
• On Thursday, Former DNC Chairwoman Donna Brazile published her first-hand account of her time leading the DNC.
  • Brazile described how the Clinton Campaign set up an arrangement with the DNC established an unfair advantage over other candidates (like Bernie Sanders).
  • ﻿Brazile claims that the DNC, which was in significant debt, gave Clinton’s campaign control over its operations in exchange for funds. She says this agreement was signed in August 2015, almost a year before Hillary secured the party’s presidential nomination.
-Ky6X_2roPcHhpMl5avb.foodForThought: Was the arrangement between the Clinton campaign & the DNC unethical? Was the DNC Presidential nomination rigged in Clinton’s favor?
-Ky6X_2roPcHhpMl5avb.name: Donna Brazile's Claims About Clinton & the DNC
-Ky6X_2roPcHhpMl5avb.shortTitle: Brazile's Claims About Clinton & the DNC

-KyJVOWYm4QjiiSFuYgi.description:
• Yesterday, there was another mass shooting, this time, at a Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs, Texas.
  • At least 26 people were killed and another 20 were wounded.
  • The gunman was a 26-year old who previously served in the Air Force. He was discharged for bad conduct after assaulting his wife and his child.
  • The gunman was stopped when a local NRA resident fired back at the gunman.
-KyJVOWYm4QjiiSFuYgi.foodForThought: How can we encourage productive, solution-oriented conversations about mass shootings in America? Is there common ground to be found?
-KyJVOWYm4QjiiSFuYgi.name: The Texas Church Shooting

-KyMyyR8mMu_6n1kzhB1.description:
• Today, voters in Virginia will elect a new governor to replace incumbent Terry McAuliffe, and the latest polls indicate a tight race.
  • The election pits Republican candidate Ed Gillespie against Democrat Ralph Northam, and has garnered attention nationwide.
  • In recent months, the opposing candidates’ campaigns have turned the state of Virginia into a battleground for a range of economic and socio-cultural issues facing the United States. 
  • Increasingly negative attack ads from both sides fueled an intense race with national implications.
-KyMyyR8mMu_6n1kzhB1.foodForThought: Will Virginia elect its first Republican governor since 2009? To what extent is this election a bellwether for the 2018 midterms?
-KyMyyR8mMu_6n1kzhB1.name: Virginia's Gubernatorial Election

-KySyrzH0FXPTpXD9nWU.description:
• Yesterday’s election results are in and Democrats emerged as big winners.
  • In Virginia’s highly watched governor race, Ralph Northam (D) defeated Ed Gillespie (R) by 9 points. Democrats also made huge gains in Virginia’s House of Delegates, picking up at least 15 seats.
  • The other 2017 governor race took place in New Jersey, and Phil Murphy (D) defeated Lt. Gov. Kim Guadagno (R).
-KySyrzH0FXPTpXD9nWU.foodForThought: What lessons should both parties take from the 2017 election results?
-KySyrzH0FXPTpXD9nWU.name: 2017 Election Results

-KyXzHUGrzTVQ8tySp93.description:
• Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman recently authorized the arrests of many powerful Saudi citizens in an anti-corruption drive.
  • The move is sparking interest across the globe as Saudi Arabia finds itself in a precarious place as its new royalty works to solidify power.
-KyXzHUGrzTVQ8tySp93.foodForThought: How should we interpret the recent string of high-profile arrests in Saudi Arabia? Are the arrests justifiable?
-KyXzHUGrzTVQ8tySp93.name: Saudi Arabia's Crackdown

-KynleeInTqc5nzEjJgp.description:
• Last week, the International Consortium of Investigative Journalists (ICIJ) published the “Paradise Papers”.
  • These papers, which were stolen and then leaked to the ICIJ by an anonymous source, shed light on massive amounts of capital stored in offshore tax havens by corporations, financial institutions and individuals.
  • Those implicated for (mostly legal) tax avoidance practices include: The Queen of England, U2’s Bono, the lead fundraiser for Canada’s Prime Minister Trudeau and Trump’s US Commerce Secretary, Wilbur Ross. Many of the tactics outlined by the papers are used by major corporations like Apple.
-KynleeInTqc5nzEjJgp.foodForThought: Is outrage over the contents of the Paradise Papers justified? Was the ICIJ right to publish the leaked papers?
-KynleeInTqc5nzEjJgp.name: The Paradise Papers & Offshore Tax Havens

-KyswqLHEEB7PFy1XjCR.description:
• About a year ago, AT&T announced its agreement to acquire Time Warner in an $85B mega-deal.
  • This merger is back in the news because this week, the Justice Department reportedly asked AT&T to sell off Turner Broadcasting (the parent of CNN) as a pre-requisite for deal approval. This drew extra headlines given President Trump’s well-known disdain for CNN.
  • The proposed deal would be a vertical merger, meaning it would integrate two businesses from different levels of an industry. AT&T is the nation’s largest pay TV provider, 2nd largest wireless company, and 3rd largest broadband provider. And Time Warner is one of the nation’s largest content companies and the owner of CNN, HBO, Warner Bros. and others.
-KyswqLHEEB7PFy1XjCR.foodForThought: Should the Department of Justice approve the AT&T - Time Warner merger? Should any divestitures be required?
-KyswqLHEEB7PFy1XjCR.name: The AT&T - Time Warner Merger

-KyxhrGx_qIIU2Z2f2uN.description:
• Bitcoin, the leading digital cryptocurrency by market capitalization, has experienced a tremendously volatile year.
  • The value of a single bitcoin has risen 700% this year to a high of $7,146 and is up 3,500% since 2015.
  • In some circles, there is widespread talk of a speculative cryptocurrency bubble. However, many others believe that bitcoin and similar blockchain-enabled technologies are paving the way for a fundamental technological revolution.
-KyxhrGx_qIIU2Z2f2uN.foodForThought: Is the current bitcoin price the result of a speculative bubble? Or is it indicative of the revolutionary promise of the cryptocurrency?
-KyxhrGx_qIIU2Z2f2uN.name: The Volatile Value of Bitcoin

-Kz4U_bppGPAepNP6ElY.description:
• Alabama is holding a US Senate special election in four weeks. The race is between Doug Jones (Democrat) and Roy Moore (Republican).
  • Last week, the Washington Post published an account of four women describing sexual interactions that they had as teens with the much older Roy Moore.
  • Moore is strongly denying the allegations and has insisted that he will not leave the senate race. Yesterday, he penned an open letter to Sean Hannity in which he defended his reputation and discredited an accuser. Meanwhile, accusations against Moore keep piling up.
  • In DC, the GOP is reportedly considering scenarios that would prevent Moore from winning the election while still preserving their party’s Senate seat.
-Kz4U_bppGPAepNP6ElY.foodForThought: What is the best path forward for members of the GOP who disapprove of Roy Moore’s candidacy? Should they intervene in the special election?
-Kz4U_bppGPAepNP6ElY.name: Roy Moore and the Alabama Senate Race
-Kz4U_bppGPAepNP6ElY.shortTitle: Roy Moore and the Alabama Senate Race

-KzAe6E_n9_JECGtS8pM.description:
• The individual mandate — the requirement that all Americans obtain medical insurance through either private or public options or pay a tax penalty for non-compliance —has long been one of the most controversial components of the Affordable Care Act. 
  • The debate over the issue resurfaced in connection with current attempts to pass tax reform legislation in congress. 
  • Yesterday, House Republicans successfully passed their tax plan, but for the bill to become law it will need to be aligned with its Senate counterpart. 
  • The current Senate tax reform proposal includes a repeal of the individual mandate, a key difference from the plan passed by the House. The inclusion of the repeal will factor heavily in the votes on tax legislation.
-KzAe6E_n9_JECGtS8pM.foodForThought: Is the individual mandate component of the Affordable Care Act effective? Will the inclusion of its repeal ultimately help or undermine Republican tax reform efforts?
-KzAe6E_n9_JECGtS8pM.name: Revisiting the Individual Healthcare Mandate

-KzQGZaCNmy3mcwUgHrF.description:
• Robert Mugabe is a controversial and divisive figure who has led Zimbabwe for the past four decades. Although some see him as a hero of the African liberation struggle, many others deride him as a dictator who has committed human rights atrocities and destroyed Zimbabwe’s economy.
  • A few weeks ago, Mugabe fired his Vice President, Emmerson Mnangagwa. This firing was widely perceived as an attempt by Mugabe to pave the way for his unpopular wife, Grace, to succeed him.
  • Last week, the Zimbabwe Defense Force took over and detained Mugabe. Soon after, thousands of protesters hit the streets calling for Mugabe’s resignation.
  • In a highly anticipated speech last night, Mugabe surprised many people by refusing to step down. After the speech, the ruling ZANU-PF party resolved to bring a motion to parliament on Tuesday to impeach Mugabe.
-KzQGZaCNmy3mcwUgHrF.foodForThought: Is the political upheaval in Zimbabwe a cause for optimism? Should the military and the ZANU-PF demand Mugabe’s impeachment?
-KzQGZaCNmy3mcwUgHrF.mobile_img_attr: Press Service of the President of Russia
-KzQGZaCNmy3mcwUgHrF.name: Political Upheaval in Zimbabwe

-KzVseuo9F8PIy_8F6jc.description:
• Today, the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) announced that it would reverse net neutrality regulations.
  • The FCC’s proposal, spearheaded by chairman Ajit Pai, is expected to be approved by a 3-to-2 party line vote during a December 14th meeting among the agency’s five commissioners.
  • Net neutrality is the principle that Internet Service Providers (ISPs) and regulators should treat all Internet traffic equally. Under net neutrality protections, an ISP cannot block or slow down access to any content on the web.
-KzVseuo9F8PIy_8F6jc.foodForThought: Is the FCC's decision to roll back regulations a good one? What would this mean for competition, markets, and consumers?
-KzVseuo9F8PIy_8F6jc.name: The FCC and Net Neutrality

-Kz_NZdBNqDT275N9WP-.description:
• The GOP's tax plan could have large repercussions on the higher education system in the US. 
  • The proposed plan eliminates a deduction on interest paid on student loans. It also includes reductions in tuition tax credits, moves to treat employer-provided tuition payments as taxable income, and proposes taxing endowment incomes at private universities. 
  • The House's plan successfully passed last week, but for the bill to become law, it will need to be aligned with its Senate counterpart.
-Kz_NZdBNqDT275N9WP-.foodForThought: How will the GOP’s tax plan impact higher education? Is the current higher-ed tax credit system effective?
-Kz_NZdBNqDT275N9WP-.name: The Tax Plan's Implications for Higher Education

-KzkG3t8kq8XXyXFxK3a.description:
• First proposed in 2008, the Keystone XL pipeline seeks to transport Canadian oil to refineries located along the U.S. Gulf Coast. 
  • The project has been mired in controversy as it's been fiercely opposed by environmentalists and the “Keep it in the Ground” movement.
  • The pipeline was in the news recently for two reasons: Firstly, Nebraska officials voted to allow the pipeline to cross the state — a critical step towards completing the pipeline network. Secondly, last Thursday, roughly 210,000 gallons of oil leaked from the pipeline and spilled in South Dakota.
-KzkG3t8kq8XXyXFxK3a.foodForThought: Is Keystone XL a necessary addition to the 72,000 miles of crude oil pipelines in the US, or will it put the environment at risk and exacerbate climate change?
-KzkG3t8kq8XXyXFxK3a.name: The Keystone XL Pipeline

-KzwL33yIbZlmca-1AOw.description:
• Over the past few months, numerous prominent men have been accused of sexual harassment and assault.
  • Those accused span across industries and political parties. Here’s an incomplete list of those who have been in the news for bad behavior:
  • Charlie Rose (CBS newsman), Glenn Thrush (NYTimes reporter), Sen. Al Franken (D-MN), John Lasseter (Pixar Co-Founder), Rep. John Conyers (D-MI), Roy Moore (Alabama GOP Senate Candidate), Kevin Spacey (House of Cards), Harvey Weinstein (Hollywood Producer), Pres. Trump, former Pres. Clinton and former Pres. George H.W. Bush.
-KzwL33yIbZlmca-1AOw.foodForThought: Can one clearly define sexual harassment? Will the recent wave of accusations lead to positive change? If so, what might this change look like?
-KzwL33yIbZlmca-1AOw.name: The Wave of Sexual Harassment Accusations

-L--PH-9b5hiKz_kh91Y.description:
• The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) was created under the Dodd-Frank Act in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. The bureau was intended to be a federal watchdog that would protect consumers against misleading or improper financial services.
  • The agency’s structure differs from that of other regulators – it is led by a single director who is appointed by the President, rather than by a chairman and commissions.
  • Richard Cordray, the CFPB’s first director, resigned last Friday.
  • There is currently confusion over who should be acting director in his absence. Cordray appointed Leandra English, but President Trump appointed Mike Mulvaney. Both “acting directors” showed up for work today.
  • Regardless of who becomes the interim acting director, both critics and supporters of the CFPB argue that President Trump’s long-term choice of a new director will have big implications for consumers and for the financial industry.
-L--PH-9b5hiKz_kh91Y.foodForThought: Has the CFPB imposed unnecessary regulations that hurt businesses, or is it an essential agency that prioritizes and protects consumer interests?
-L--PH-9b5hiKz_kh91Y.name: The Future of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)

-L-521QNpQHVZd5tlYaj.description:
• On Monday, the British royal family announced the engagement of Prince Harry to Meghan Markle. Unsurprisingly, the announcement unleashed a wave of media coverage and excitement over another royal wedding.
  • The engagement garnered additional attention because Meghan Markle, an American actress best known for her role on Suits, is divorced, bi-racial, and an outspoken-feminist.
  • The happy couple plans to get married in Spring 2018. They are expected to be known as the duke and duchess of Sussex after the wedding. Currently, Prince Harry is sixth in line for the throne.
-L-521QNpQHVZd5tlYaj.foodForThought: How significant Is the royal engagement between Meghan Markle and Prince Harry? Is the British monarchy changing with the times?
-L-521QNpQHVZd5tlYaj.name: Prince Harry & Meghan Markle’s Engagement

-L-AMD2uEQs-3fYYG8WO.description:
• After a two-month lull, North Korea resumed its ballistic missile testing on Tuesday night with the launch of a new ICBM (Inter-Continental Ballistic Missile) into the air, landing in the ocean off the coast of Japan. 
  • The test revealed North Korea’s latest ballistic missile upgrade — the Hwasong 15 — which reached a height of 2,800 miles, higher than any previous missiles seen from the regime. 
  • Nuclear scientists have confirmed that if launched on a different trajectory, the same missile could likely reach any part of the continental US, though its range would probably be significantly reduced if it were carrying a nuclear weapon. 
  • According to North Korean officials, the latest missile launch was meant to communicate the country’s nuclear capability and viability as a nuclear power. Following the test, President Trump has called for increased economic sanctions on the country, and international tensions regarding North Korea remain high.
-L-AMD2uEQs-3fYYG8WO.foodForThought: How should the US respond to North Korean defiance on missile testing? What is the most effective approach to North Korean weapons development and nuclear claims?
-L-AMD2uEQs-3fYYG8WO.name: North Korea's Missile Tests

-L-H5ClbBQWOIt7w4whz.description:
• On Wednesday, President Trump got into a twitter argument with British Prime Minister Theresa May.
  • The argument started when the President retweeted unverified videos from a UK hate group called "Britain-First". These videos claim to show Muslims committing violent acts against Christians. One of the videos was four years old. Another video labeled an attacker as a "Muslim migrant", although later it was shown that the person in the video actually wasn't a Muslim migrant.
  • The President defended his tweets, arguing that even if the videos weren't real, the threat was real. Theresa May and many others quickly condemned the President's behavior.
-L-H5ClbBQWOIt7w4whz.foodForThought: Is the outrage over the President's latest tweets justified? How much of an impact does his twitter account have on policy?
-L-H5ClbBQWOIt7w4whz.name: The President's Recent Tweets

-L-VXNkrN3TBKwS4A7UO.description:
• Early Saturday morning the Senate passed their version of the tax reform bill, marking a legislative victory for Republican lawmakers. ﻿The final step will be to reconcile the Senate and House versions of the bill, which party leaders hope to get done before Christmas.
  • The Senate bill significantly lowers the corporate tax rate and gives tax breaks to most Americans, while adding substantially—$1 trillion or more, by some estimates—to the federal deficit.
  • While parts of the Senate bill differ from its House counterpart—the Senate bill repeals the individual mandate component of the ACA but keeps the student loan interest rate deduction, for example—many components like the corporate tax rate, tax cuts across income brackets, and business investments are already aligned across the two versions of the bill, making reconciliation likely.
-L-VXNkrN3TBKwS4A7UO.foodForThought: Will the changes proposed in the tax bill stimulate economic growth, as predicted by Republicans? Will the growth be enough to offset the deficit increase?
-L-VXNkrN3TBKwS4A7UO.name: The Tax Bill, Now Senate-Approved

-L-_3Ou39uIRpwwxo6KF.description:
• Last Sunday, the College Football Playoff ranking committee released its final poll and announced which four teams will compete for the NCAA Division 1 football national championship.
  • The top four teams that will compete in the playoffs are: 1. Clemson (12-1), 2. Oklahoma (12-1), 3. Georgia (12-1), 4. Alabama (11-1). 5. Ohio State (11-2) barely missed the cut.
  • The selection, as expected, was controversial, particularly since Ohio State won the Big 10 championship while Alabama did not compete for the SEC Championship.
-L-_3Ou39uIRpwwxo6KF.foodForThought: Did the ranking committee get the selection right? Should Alabama or Ohio State have gotten the fourth spot?
-L-_3Ou39uIRpwwxo6KF.name: The College Football Playoff

-L-dmLUh6_SBwOcjaZRr.description:
• On Tuesday, President Trump told Israeli and Arab leaders that he plans to recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s capital. Trump is expected to officially announce this decision any day.
  • The announcement is highly symbolic for now – especially since the US embassy will remain in Tel Aviv for the time being. However, it will send a big message to the global community as it represents a reversal of decades-old US policy in the region.
-L-dmLUh6_SBwOcjaZRr.foodForThought: Should the US Recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s Capital? Will this help or hinder peace efforts in the region?
-L-dmLUh6_SBwOcjaZRr.name: Capital Status for Jerusalem?

-L-j8ONGmadTWb8zPvDs.description:
• On Monday, Michael Flynn — the former National Security Advisor for the Trump administration — pled guilty to lying to the FBI about his communications with Russia’s US ambassador.
  • Flynn is the first member of the Trump administration to plead guilty to charges in the Russia investigation.
  • Since the news broke, some media outlets have argued that this plea deal strengthens the charges of collusion and obstruction of justice against President Trump.
  • Other outlets take the opposite view and claim that this particular guilty plea is simply process-related and has nothing to do with so-called “collusion”.
-L-j8ONGmadTWb8zPvDs.foodForThought: Should the Trump administration be worried by Flynn’s guilty plea? Does this news change the way you think about the Russia investigation?
-L-j8ONGmadTWb8zPvDs.name: Is Flynn’s Guilty Plea a Game-Changer?
-L-j8ONGmadTWb8zPvDs.shortTitle: Is Flynn’s Guilty Plea a Game-Changer?

-L-oVh2bf5ydBf8OxNUi.description:
• On Tuesday, the International Olympic Committee announced that it is banning Russia from the 2018 Winter Olympics in PyeongChang, South Korea.
  • The decision is meant to serve as a punishment for a massive Russian-government backed doping scandal that involved more than 1,000 athletes, including many medal-winners.
  • The IOC still plans to allow drug-free Russian athletes to compete in the 2018 Winter games, but they must compete under a neutral flag.
-L-oVh2bf5ydBf8OxNUi.foodForThought: Did the International Olympic Committee’s ban go too far or not far enough? Who is impacted most by the ban?
-L-oVh2bf5ydBf8OxNUi.name: Should Russia be banned from the 2018 Olympics?

-L02S4DyJbZw5TOJb-3U.description:
• On Thursday, Senator Al Franken (D – MN) announced that he would resign due to sexual harassment allegations.
  • The tone of his resignation speech was seen by many as mournful and defiant, but not apologetic. 
  • This decision came after many prominent female Democratic Senators (and many men) publicly pressured Franken to step down. Some saw this decision as an attempt by Democrats to claim the ‘moral high ground’ when it comes to accusations of sexual harassment.
-L02S4DyJbZw5TOJb-3U.foodForThought: Were Democrats right to pressure Franken to resign? Is sexual harassment a black and white issue or should it be evaluated on a case-by-case basis?
-L02S4DyJbZw5TOJb-3U.name: Should Al Franken have resigned?

-L07C924bc67Y4lTpuYi.description:
• Last week marked a victory for President Trump's latest travel ban executive order when the Supreme Court ruled against efforts to block its implementation. 
  • The executive order in question was President Trump's third travel ban order, which bans US entry from most citizens of six Muslim-majority nations, and places restrictions on immigration from two additional countries: Venezuela and North Korea.
  • The travel ban was previously blocked in the 4th and 9th federal circuits, but the Supreme Court ruled against the attempts to stop implementation of the order until a decision is made in the lower courts.
  • The attempted blocks were made on the basis that Trump's order exceeded the authority granted to the executive branch and that it contained unconstitutional discrimination against Muslims. The lower courts expect to hear the government's appeal and issue a ruling soon.
  • Following an attempted terrorist attack today in New York City, the White House and other Republican politicians have publicly reiterated the necessity of the travel ban.
-L07C924bc67Y4lTpuYi.foodForThought: Is Trump's travel ban constitutional? What are the consequences of its implementation?
-L07C924bc67Y4lTpuYi.name: Trump's Travel Ban

-L0Fb4fTPtp9seRx_b3A.description:
• Last night, Doug Jones (D) defeated Roy Moore (R) in Alabama’s special Senate election. This is the first time in over 25 years that a Democratic Senator has been elected in deep-red Alabama.
  • Doug Jones was the beneficiary of huge turnout among African American voters, and many Democrats see this upset victory as a highly promising sign for the 2018 midterm elections.
  • Currently, the margin of victory stands at ~1.5%. Roy Moore has refused to concede, claiming that a review of write-in votes and outstanding military votes could reduce the margin of victory to under 0.5%, triggering an automatic recount provision.
  • While the Democrats picked up Jeff Sessions' vacant Alabama Senate seat, the balance of the Senate still narrowly favors the Republicans at 51:49. Jones is expected to take office in early 2018.
-L0Fb4fTPtp9seRx_b3A.foodForThought: Was this election simply a referendum on Roy Moore, or was it a broader referendum on the Republican party?
-L0Fb4fTPtp9seRx_b3A.name: The Alabama Special Election Results

-L0K_5qekJu3eXfI9ac6.description:
• The Federal Communications Commission (FCC), led by Ajit Pai, is set to vote today on its repeal of net neutrality regulations.
  • Net neutrality is the principle that Internet Service Providers (ISPs) and regulators should treat all Internet traffic equally.
  • Under net neutrality protections, an ISP cannot block or slow down access to any content on the web.
-L0K_5qekJu3eXfI9ac6.foodForThought: What are the arguments for and against net neutrality? If you were an FCC commissioner, which way would you vote?
-L0K_5qekJu3eXfI9ac6.name: Revisiting the Net Neutrality Debate

-L0PzCNeNX1TRm4VMn-K.description:
• On Thursday morning, Disney — led by CEO Bob Iger — agreed to purchase most of 21st Century Fox, the media empire created by Rupert Murdoch.
  • The all-stock deal, valued at ~$50 - $65B, will give Disney ownership of assets like Fox Searchlight film studios, FX and National Geographic, Fox’s regional sports networks, and large stakes in Sky Plc. This deal will also make Disney the majority owner of Hulu.
  • The Murdoch family will still maintain ownership of its news divisions, including Fox News.
  • The deal is still subject to regulatory approval. This could be a bumpy road, particularly given the Justice Department’s opposition the other media mega-merger between AT&T and Time Warner.
-L0PzCNeNX1TRm4VMn-K.foodForThought: As a consumer, should you be excited about the Disney-Fox mega-merger? Is this a good deal for both companies?
-L0PzCNeNX1TRm4VMn-K.name: The Disney & 21st Century Fox Mega-Merger

-L0c0w7D1dj_QmQipEsC.description:
• The GOP has finished reconciling the Senate and House versions of the tax bill. The final vote on the bill will likely take place next week.
  • The bill is widely expected to pass, especially after Senators Marco Rubio (FL) and Bob Corker (TN) flipped their votes from “no” to “yes”.
  • Last minute changes to the bill included: a larger tax break for top earners, the preservation of several deductions (student-loan interest, excessive medical expenses), the preservation of a tax break for graduate students, and an expanded child tax credit. The child tax credit expansion was included to win Rubio’s vote.
  • The final 1,000-page bill still includes a repeal of the individual healthcare mandate, a large reduction in the corporate tax rate (from 35% to 21%), and lower individual tax rates for most Americans.
-L0c0w7D1dj_QmQipEsC.foodForThought: Both parties use research-backed arguments to support claims about the tax-bills’ outcomes. Which side is correct?
-L0c0w7D1dj_QmQipEsC.name: The Final Tax Reform Bill

-L0hCWmGGadqO0wuMnMY.description:
• On Sunday, the world’s largest futures exchange launched a bitcoin futures contract.
  • By definition, a futures contract is an agreement to buy or sell an asset at a future date at an agreed-upon price.
  • Some see the launch of bitcoin futures as an important step that helps to legitimize the cryptocurrency since futures contracts let institutional investors get in on the crypto-currency bandwagon and might help to enable a bitcoin exchange traded fund (ETF). Others think this development could make the bitcoin bubble even more dangerous.
  • This year, bitcoin has surged more than 1700% with the value of a single coin reaching a price above $19,000.
-L0hCWmGGadqO0wuMnMY.foodForThought: Given bitcoin’s recent price appreciation and the launch of futures contracts, is this a smart time to invest? What are the bullish and bearish arguments for the cryptocurrency?
-L0hCWmGGadqO0wuMnMY.name: The Current Bitcoin Craze

-L0oBqxtthiBVLLLFKYT.description:
• On Monday, an Amtrak train was derailed on a new route in Washington State. At least 3 people were killed and over 70 were injured.
  • Early investigations indicate that the train may have been travelling at ~80-mph in a 30-mph zone.
  • After the crash, President Trump offered condolences to victims on Twitter and claimed that the train accident shows why his “soon to be submitted infrastructure plan must be approved quickly”.
-L0oBqxtthiBVLLLFKYT.foodForThought: Does this crash indicate a need for more, or less, federal infrastructure funding? What would an ideal infrastructure bill look like?
-L0oBqxtthiBVLLLFKYT.name: The Fatal Amtrak Crash in Washington
-L0oBqxtthiBVLLLFKYT.shortTitle: The Fatal Amtrak Crash in Washington

-L0rTA3UbL8IFyGvm2nk.description:
• On Wednesday, President Trump and the GOP passed their historic tax legislation, a bill which many Republicans say has been in the works for nearly a decade.
  • The bill cuts the corporate tax rate from 35% to 21% and provides tax cuts to around 80% of Americans (according to the non-partisan Tax Policy Center). It also repeals the Affordable Care Act’s highly controversial individual mandate.
  • The Congressional Budget Office announced that the bill could add up to $1.4T to the national deficit over the next ten years, but many Republicans dispute this assertion and claim that strong economic growth will enable the bill to pay for itself.
-L0rTA3UbL8IFyGvm2nk.foodForThought: What does the passage of the tax bill mean for President Trump’s legacy? How will it personally impact you?
-L0rTA3UbL8IFyGvm2nk.name: The Historic Tax Bill Passed. What Now?
-L0rTA3UbL8IFyGvm2nk.shortTitle: The Historic Tax Bill Passed. What Now?

-L0yMoZUIuXzGYRc3mva.description:
• On Thursday, The United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) voted 128-9, with 35 abstentions and 21 countries absent, to pass a non-binding resolution that rejects the United States’ decision to declare Jerusalem the capital of Israel.
  • The vote passed shortly after Nikki Haley, the United States’ ambassador to the U.N., gave a speech stating that the U.S. will “remember this day” and be “taking names” of those countries that challenged the U.S.’ decision. Some say this speech implied that the foreign aid that those nations receive from the U.S. would be reduced or revoked.
  • Currently, the U.S. is the single largest contributor to the U.N.
  • This U.N. vote is symbolic and is non-binding. After the vote, Haley declared the vote “null and void,” and stated that the U.S. would move forward with plans to move its embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.
-L0yMoZUIuXzGYRc3mva.foodForThought: What is the purpose of a symbolic vote such as this one? Should the U.S. vary its U.N. funding based on its relationships with member nations?
-L0yMoZUIuXzGYRc3mva.name: The U.N. Rejects Jerusalem’s Capital Status
-L0yMoZUIuXzGYRc3mva.shortTitle: The U.N. Rejects Jerusalem as Capital

-L1LLXl73awPEL3WDX8z.description:
• The latest chapter in the Star Wars saga, The Last Jedi, opened in theaters on December 15th to universal acclaim from critics.
  • However, the movie has turned out to be quite polarizing amongst everyday moviegoers and Star Wars fans, resulting in some backlash towards the film.
  • As of Tuesday, Rotten Tomatoes’ score for the movie amongst critics is at 92%; the score amongst the audience is at 52%.
  • So far, The Last Jedi has grossed $791.6 million worldwide and $395.6 million in the U.S. It is now the 3rd highest grossing film in the U.S. for 2017, behind Beauty and the Beast ($504 million) and Wonder Woman ($412.5 million).
  • The Last Jedi had the highest U.S. weekend opening in 2017 at $220 million, placing it far ahead of the Beauty and the Beast’s box office opening of $174.7 million.
-L1LLXl73awPEL3WDX8z.foodForThought:
What did people love or hate about The Last Jedi?

[Warning: Spoilers included in article summaries!]
-L1LLXl73awPEL3WDX8z.name: Does 'Star Wars: The Last Jedi' Live Up To Its Namesake?

-L1QvPoxh0MTszGzGoVg.description:
• The Special Council investigation into Russian election interference, led by Former FBI director Robert Mueller, has been the subject of recent criticism from several Republican congressmen. Critics include Florida representative Francis Rooney and Arizona representative Andy Biggs.
  • Critics allege Mueller has mishandled the investigation, staging a witch hunt without base in truth.
  • President Trump has added his denouncement of both Mueller and the investigation multiple times via Twitter.
  • Some see the recent attacks on Mueller as a dangerous tactic designed to halt the investigation before it could prove further wrongdoing by Trump or those connected to the Trump campaign during the election. 
  • Earlier, the investigation led to charges against Michael Flynn after he pled guilty to lying to the FBI.
-L1QvPoxh0MTszGzGoVg.foodForThought: Is Mueller conducting the Special Council investigation effectively and fairly? What is the motivation behind recent efforts to discredit him?
-L1QvPoxh0MTszGzGoVg.name: Mueller and the Russia Investigation

-L1VgXomGD46yCaU95--.description:
• As the year 2017 draws to a close, the world is now looking back on President Trump’s first year in office and evaluating his successes and failures.
  • President Trump’s actions throughout the year have often elicited polarized responses. As his supporters and critics alike consider the year in review, conclusions remain divided.
  • While some believe the President has contributed to a disastrous year for the United States, others view the first year of his presidency as a historic turning point in the right direction for America.
-L1VgXomGD46yCaU95--.foodForThought: How has President Trump performed in office so far? How much credit should he receive for the political milestones that have been achieved?
-L1VgXomGD46yCaU95--.name: Assessing President Trump’s First Year in Office
-L1VgXomGD46yCaU95--.shortTitle: President Trump’s First Year in Office

-L1sVyfjOsVkanScpMzg.description:
• The U.S. economy has continued its steady upward trajectory, surpassing 3% growth over the past two quarters.
  • Unemployment recently hit a 17-year low of 4.1% and the Dow has risen to a record high of nearly 25,000. Consumer confidence is up and inflation and interest rates are low.
  • President Trump has recently drawn attention to these economic figures and many on the right claim that the President deserves praise for the state of the economy.
  • However, those on the left point out that the economy hit 3% growth eight times under President Obama and that the Obama administration presided over a 3% drop in unemployment from 7.8% to 4.8%.
-L1sVyfjOsVkanScpMzg.foodForThought: Who, if anyone, deserves credit for the strong state of the U.S. economy? How sustainable is a 3% growth rate?
-L1sVyfjOsVkanScpMzg.name: The State of the U.S. Economy
-L1sVyfjOsVkanScpMzg.shortTitle: The State of the U.S. Economy

-L1x7FwM9zcawFBB4ptA.description:
• On December 9th, 2017, the Prime Minister of Iraq, Haider al-Abadi declared victory over ISIS.
  • At one point, approximately three years ago, ISIS controlled about 1/3 of Iraqi territory. In July 2017, ISIS was defeated in their de-facto capital of Mosul after a tough 9-month campaign. Then, in September 2017, the ISIS stronghold in Raqqa, Syria fell to a US-backed Kurdish coalition. 
  • The War on ISIS displaced approximately 3 million people according to the U.N.
-L1x7FwM9zcawFBB4ptA.foodForThought: What groups and leaders played the biggest roles in the defeat of ISIS? Has this story been getting sufficient coverage? Is the war truly over?
-L1x7FwM9zcawFBB4ptA.name: Victory in the War on ISIS
-L1x7FwM9zcawFBB4ptA.shortTitle: Victory in the War on ISIS

-L20zYfCeIZq_N0JVPUx.description:
Anti-government protests have erupted in Iran, fueled by poor economic conditions and inequality in the country. The protests have left at least 20 dead so far.

This development in Iran’s political climate has called into question what role the U.S. should play in the protests, if any role at all.

President Trump has voiced his support for the protesters on Twitter, stating that Iran “will see great support from the United States at the appropriate time!”
-L20zYfCeIZq_N0JVPUx.foodForThought: Should the U.S. government support the anti-government protesters in Iran? If so, how should the U.S. support the protests?
-L20zYfCeIZq_N0JVPUx.name: The Protests in Iran

-L22V9eWiluZrTZpR4cL.description:
• Anti-government protests have erupted in Iran, fueled by poor economic conditions and inequality in the country.
  • The protests have left at least 20 dead so far.
  • This development in Iran’s political climate has called into question what role the U.S. should play in the protests, if any role at all. President Trump has voiced his support for the protesters on Twitter, stating that Iran “will see great support from the United States at the appropriate time!”
-L22V9eWiluZrTZpR4cL.foodForThought: Should the U.S. government support the anti-government protesters in Iran? If so, how should the U.S. support the protests?
-L22V9eWiluZrTZpR4cL.name: The Protests in Iran

-L269vY0rmNMh3JLfKJE.description:
• On Thursday, U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions announced he would be rescinding an Obama-era policy that discouraged federal prosecutors in the Justice Department from pursuing legal charges in states where marijuana had been legalized under state law.
  • The policy, known as the Cole memo, was originally enacted in 2013, after voters in the states of Colorado and Washington voted to legalize the drug for recreational use in those states.
  • Currently, six states have legalized the purchase and sale of recreational marijuana, two states and D.C. have decriminalized possession, and 21 states allow medicinal use only. Marijuana is still illegal under federal law.
-L269vY0rmNMh3JLfKJE.foodForThought: Should the U.S. government be cracking down on marijuana laws? Should marijuana legalization be an issue left up to state laws?
-L269vY0rmNMh3JLfKJE.name: Jeff Sessions Rescinds Obama-era Marijuana Policy

-L2VcPzrpJBcA48Cwbb2.description:
• On Sunday night at the Golden Globes, Oprah Winfrey gave a speech that roused audiences into speculation of a possible presidential run in 2020 by the media star.
  • Gayle King, a close friend of Oprah’s, stated that Oprah is “very intrigued” at the prospect of a presidential run.
-L2VcPzrpJBcA48Cwbb2.foodForThought: Should Oprah run for the presidency in 2020? Would she be able to defeat Donald Trump if he were to run for a second term?
-L2VcPzrpJBcA48Cwbb2.img_attr: Lawrence Jackson, Official White House Photo [Public domain]
-L2VcPzrpJBcA48Cwbb2.name: Should Oprah Run For President?

-L2_SZmyVFvhaO9_PAKY.description:
• Last week, excerpts from a new book called “Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House” began to circulate. The book, authored by Michael Wolff, details the behavior of President Trump and his campaign and White House staff.
  • The book depicts Trump as being held in low regard by those around him (including Steve Bannon) and suggests that the President may be mentally unfit for office.
  • The author does not claim to have verified the accounts included in the book and many of the quotes in the book have been refuted.
  • On January 5th, President Trump posted tweets to discredit the book, inevitably leading to a huge anticipated spike in book sales. The President also tweeted criticisms of Bannon’s remarks in the book. On Tuesday, Bannon stepped down from Breitbart Post.
-L2_SZmyVFvhaO9_PAKY.foodForThought: Should one believe the claims made about President Trump and his staff in 'Fire and Fury'?
-L2_SZmyVFvhaO9_PAKY.name: Michael Wolff’s 'Fire and Fury' Book

-L2cBt0GnayaBQSMYm0j.description:
• On Monday, the Department of Homeland Security announced that it will eliminate the Temporary Protected Status (TPS) of 200,000 Salvadoran nationals. This means that these Salvadorans have until September 2019 to leave the United States, get a green card, or be deported.
  • The purpose of TPS is to provide short-term relief and shelter to people from foreign countries who face “extraordinary and temporary conditions."
  • TPS protections were originally granted to Salvadorans in 2001 after a string of earthquakes displaced over 1M people. Since 2001, the program has been reauthorized 11 times.
  • El Salvador is currently under an advisory warning from the State Department due to “high rates of crime and violence”.
  • On Thursday, President Trump reportedly referred to countries like El Salvador and Haiti as “s***hole” countries, drawing strong rebukes from both parties.
-L2cBt0GnayaBQSMYm0j.foodForThought: Did the Department of Homeland Security make a good decision when it terminated Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 200,000 Salvadorans?
-L2cBt0GnayaBQSMYm0j.name: The End of Temporary Protected Status for Salvadorans
-L2cBt0GnayaBQSMYm0j.shortTitle: The End of TPS for Salvadorans

-L2rvBrMN2QEhIdErpsz.description:
• On Thursday, reports of President Trump using vulgar language to refer to certain countries emerged, provoking condemnation and controversy around the globe. 
  • The president's comments were made during a meeting with bipartisan senators; according to a white house aide, Trump questioned why the US would want immigrants from “all these s---hole countries”, referring to Haiti, El Salvador, and African nations during a discussion about immigration policy. 
  • Democratic senator Dick Durbin was present at the meeting and confirmed the president’s reported comments, calling his remarks “vile, hate-filled and clearly racial in their content”, while Republican senator David Perdue, also present at the meeting, has called the media portrayal of the comments “a gross misrepresentation.”
  • In a tweet Friday morning, President Trump denied using the specific language reported, but acknowledged that the language he used was “tough”. On Sunday, Trump addressed the issue briefly, denying claims he is racist while speaking to reporters in Florida.
-L2rvBrMN2QEhIdErpsz.foodForThought: How should the US and the international community respond to President Trump's reported comments? To what extent should Trump's language be viewed as racist?
-L2rvBrMN2QEhIdErpsz.name: Donald Trump's Controversial Remarks

-L2wwFnAO3i9vBq_nnuw.description:
• This past Thursday, The Huffington Post obtained a draft of the Trump administration’s 2018 Nuclear Posture Review (NPR). The draft review calls for the modernization and expansion of the United States’ nuclear arsenal and generally puts the U.S. in a more aggressive stance.
  • Some elements of the NPR are similar to those espoused by the Obama administration. For instance, President Trump's draft NPR states that the U.S. will adhere to existing arms agreements. However, unlike Obama, Trump did not commit to reducing the role of nuclear weapons in U.S. defense policy.
  • The final version of the NPR is expected to be released in February.
-L2wwFnAO3i9vBq_nnuw.foodForThought: Does the U.S. nuclear arsenal need to be modernized and expanded? What are the pros and cons of such a decision?
-L2wwFnAO3i9vBq_nnuw.name: The State of America's Nuclear Arsenal
-L2wwFnAO3i9vBq_nnuw.shortTitle: The State of America's Nuclear Arsenal

-L313WsVYxUYXqQb_dsL.description:
• Last Thursday, Mark Zuckerberg, the CEO of Facebook, announced that one of his focus areas for 2018 is to make sure that Facebook time is “time well spent”. To achieve this goal, Facebook will update its newsfeed algorithm so that prioritizes meaningful posts from friends and family over public content.
  • Zuckerberg admitted that this change could reduce the total amount of time that users spend on Facebook, but contends that this change is the right thing to do for the company and its users.
  • This change comes after Facebook has faced increased pressure to address problems ranging from mental health issues to fake news and echo chambers.
-L313WsVYxUYXqQb_dsL.foodForThought: Should Facebook's newsfeed prioritize meaningful, personal content over public content and news?
-L313WsVYxUYXqQb_dsL.name: Facebook’s Newsfeed Revamp

-L36FOuEeAZuFFhSfzfF.description:
• On Tuesday, Dr. Ronny Jackson, the White House physician, announced the results of a mental health assessment completed by President Trump. In his press conference, Dr. Jackson shared that the President received a perfect score on the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MOCA). He also stated that the president "has absolutely no cognitive or mental issues whatsoever".
  • This announcement attracted special attention because over the past few weeks, some have taken to questioning President Trump's mental state and fitness to serve as President. President Trump has vehemently disputed these accusations over twitter.
