-L36FOuEeAZuFFhSfzfF.foodForThought: Is it fair to question the President's mental health? Should these cognition test results put doubts about President Trump's mental health to rest?
-L36FOuEeAZuFFhSfzfF.name: President Trump's Cognition Test Results

-L3DJ7V94W072V9O0sop.description:
• On Wednesday, Apple issued a press release titled, "Apple accelerates U.S. investment and job creation."
  • In this release, Apple announced that it will repatriate nearly $350B in cash that is currently held overseas.
  • The new tax bill imposes a 15.5% tax rate on this repatriated cash, a much lower figure than the 35% rate imposed before tax reform. Under the new, lower rate, Apple will pay approximately $38B in taxes on its repatriated cash.
  • In its press release, Apple also shared its decision to build another U.S. campus, promised to create 20,000 American jobs over the next five years, and disclosed its plan to give a $2,500 stock option bonus to employees.
-L3DJ7V94W072V9O0sop.foodForThought: How much of a role did corporate tax reform play in Apple’s investment announcement?
-L3DJ7V94W072V9O0sop.name: Apple’s Decision to Return Overseas Cash
-L3DJ7V94W072V9O0sop.shortTitle: Apple’s Decision to Return Overseas Cash

-L3QlQOvvbwRLPguQ0hl.description:
On Friday, the US Congress failed to pass legislation funding federal agencies and operations, resulting in a government shutdown that began at midnight on Saturday. An appropriations act extending funding for one month passed in the House, but was thwarted in the Senate by a Democrat-led filibuster.

The efforts to pass an appropriations bill became embroiled in immigration policy disputes, particularly concerning DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals), which the Trump Administration rescinded in September. Legislation ending the shutdown could potentially be passed as early as noon on Monday, but for the time being only “essential” government employees can report to work, and a small handful of government agencies can remain open for a limited time. Most government agencies and operations will remain closed until a funding extension is passed.
-L3QlQOvvbwRLPguQ0hl.foodForThought: Who deserves the blame for the government shutdown? What does the shutdown mean for the future of the US Congress?
-L3QlQOvvbwRLPguQ0hl.name: The Government Shutdown

-L3Vj2ld5bPmi6nHk8Q4.description:
• On Saturday, protesters all across the United States took to the streets as part of the 2018 Women’s March. This was the second Women’s’ March in as many years, and took place on the anniversary of Donald Trump’s inauguration.
  • Many participated, including over 200,000 in New York City and over 600,000 in Los Angeles.
  • Marchers were advocating for a number of issues, namely women’s rights and equality.
-L3Vj2ld5bPmi6nHk8Q4.foodForThought: Is protesting an effective way to advocate for change? Do you support the idea of the Women’s March?
-L3Vj2ld5bPmi6nHk8Q4.name: The 2018 Women’s March

-L3aTVqukZMFMIXDyWee.description:
• The 3-day government shutdown ended on Monday when 81 senators voted to pass a short-term spending bill that funds the government until February 8th. The bill granted six years of additional funding to the Children's Health Insurance Program but it did not include protections for the "Dreamers".
  • A bi-partisan group of senators reportedly spearheaded a weekend of tough negotiations and put together the framework for this deal. As part of these negotiations, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) promised to allow an immigration vote sometime soon and announced that he would ensure a "level playing field".
-L3aTVqukZMFMIXDyWee.foodForThought: Did either party win or lose the shutdown battle? What implications does the end of the shutdown have for the immigration debate?
-L3aTVqukZMFMIXDyWee.name: The End of the Government Shutdown
-L3aTVqukZMFMIXDyWee.shortTitle: The End of the Government Shutdown

-L3eUJinnjDByi_YXgtk.description:
• On Monday, President Trump introduced new tariffs of up to 30% on imports of solar energy cells and solar panels.
  • The solar industry is a $28 billion industry, and 80% of its materials are imported from foreign countries.
  • Trump also placed tariffs of up to 50% on imports of washing machines. South Korea and Mexico are the largest U.S. importers of washing machine materials.
  • The move aims to protect American manufacturers by targeting imports from China, Mexico, and other countries.
-L3eUJinnjDByi_YXgtk.foodForThought: How will these new tariffs impact the American manufacturing and solar industries? How does this move affect trade relations with China, Mexico, and other countries?
-L3eUJinnjDByi_YXgtk.name: New Tariffs on Solar Energy Imports
-L3eUJinnjDByi_YXgtk.shortTitle: New Tariffs on Solar Energy Imports

-L3kc4ZBas5STrcdkTDo.description:
• Last week, Larry Fink - the founder of the $6.3 trillion asset manager BlackRock - sent a letter that called on S&P 500 CEOs to articulate their societal impact and to explain how they would evolve in the pursuit of long-term, sustainable growth.
  • Fink's letter has reportedly been a big topic of conversation at the World Economic Forum in Davos, an annual summit that brings together the top business leaders, politicians and economists in the world.
  • Fink's letter reflects a much broader debate that has gripped business theorists for years: Do businesses primarily have a duty to maximize shareholder returns (shareholder theory), or should shareholders' financial interests be balanced with the interests of employees, customers and the community (stakeholder theory)?
-L3kc4ZBas5STrcdkTDo.foodForThought: Do businesses have societal obligations beyond maximizing shareholder value?
-L3kc4ZBas5STrcdkTDo.name: Larry Fink's Letter to CEOs

-L3zgS2sBlBJb0wtS66K.description:
• Last Friday, President Trump gave a highly anticipated speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, an annual gathering of top business, political and economic leaders.
  • During his upbeat speech, the President declared that the United States is "open for business" and claimed that "the world is witnessing the resurgence of a strong and prosperous America".
  • He warned that the U.S. would not turn a blind eye to unfair trade practices but added that "America First does not mean America alone."
  • The President did include a quick attack against the news media in his speech (which was met with some jeers), but overall, his speech was met with polite applause.
  • Trump is the first sitting U.S. President to attend the World Economic Forum in 18 years.
-L3zgS2sBlBJb0wtS66K.foodForThought: How should you assess President Trump's speech at the World Economic Forum? Has his America-First policy been effective?
-L3zgS2sBlBJb0wtS66K.mobile_img_attr: Official White House Photo by Shealah Craighead
-L3zgS2sBlBJb0wtS66K.name: President Trump's Speech in Davos

-L43AW9N2_np5EXCWugi.description:
• On Thursday, the New York Times reported that President Trump gave the order to fire Special Counsel Robert S. Mueller back in June 2017, but changed his mind after his lawyer, Donald McGhan, threatened to resign if Trump fired Mueller. The President disputed the New York Times' report.
  • The Special Counsel is investigating Russian interference in the 2016 election.
-L43AW9N2_np5EXCWugi.foodForThought: Does the NYTimes' report strengthen a case for obstruction of justice against President Trump? Should Congress enact legislation to protect Mueller from being fired?
-L43AW9N2_np5EXCWugi.name: President Trump's Reversal on Firing Mueller
-L43AW9N2_np5EXCWugi.shortTitle: Pres. Trump's Reversal on Firing Mueller

-L4CtngaSw3ZVUCyIgX8.description:
• On Tuesday evening President Trump delivered his first State of the Union address to a joint session of Congress. The president spoke for 90 minutes, making this the third-longest State of the Union in the past 50 years.
  • Focal points of the speech included: the economic successes of the president’s first year in office, immigration, healthcare, and foreign policy.
-L4CtngaSw3ZVUCyIgX8.foodForThought: What were the highlights and lowlights of the President's speech? How is the speech being characterized by each political party?
-L4CtngaSw3ZVUCyIgX8.name: President Trump's State of the Union Address

-L4H70cGJGASjqyLofrl.description:
• Earlier this week, Andrew McCabe, the Deputy Director of the FBI, announced that he would retire from his post on March 18th.
  • President Trump has accused McCabe - and the broader FBI organization - of unfair bias against his administration. The President has specifically drawn attention to the time when McCabe's wife accepted nearly $500,000 from Terry McAuliffe, governor of Virginia and long-time friend to Hillary Clinton, during a failed state senate campaign in 2015.
  • A recent report also suggests that McCabe waited a month before informing Congress of Hillary Clinton's emails on Weiner's laptop.
-L4H70cGJGASjqyLofrl.foodForThought: Is the FBI biased against the President? Should McCabe have resigned?
-L4H70cGJGASjqyLofrl.mobile_img_attr: Lonnie Tague for the Department of Justice
-L4H70cGJGASjqyLofrl.name: McCabe Resigns As FBI Deputy Director
-L4H70cGJGASjqyLofrl.shortTitle: McCabe Resigns As FBI Deputy Director

-L4MJZAonrjZl-n7AGn2.description:
• Super Bowl LII will kickoff Sunday at 6:30pm ET on NBC. The game features a match-up between the New England Patriots — led by QB Tom Brady and coach Bill Belichick — and the Philadelphia Eagles — led by back-up QB Nick Foles and coach Doug Pederson.
  • The Patriots are looking to defend their Super Bowl title and 40-year old QB Brady is attempting to win his sixth NFL championship.
  • The Eagles are looking for their first championship in the modern Super Bowl era. Their last Super Bowl appearance was in 2004. They lost to... the New England Patriots.
-L4MJZAonrjZl-n7AGn2.foodForThought: Will the Patriots or Eagles emerge victorious? What are the strengths of each team?
-L4MJZAonrjZl-n7AGn2.name: Who Will Win the 2018 Super Bowl?

-L4ZLEPOvcZV1tNw6E4o.description:
• On Friday, House Republicans released a highly publicized memo, written by staff of Republican Devin Nunes and formally titled Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act Abuses at the Department of Justice and the Federal Bureau of Investigation. 
  • The memo contains allegations of misconduct levied against the FBI, specifically questioning the FBI means of obtaining a FISA warrant during its investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential elections.
  • President Trump tweeted the memo “totally vindicates” him, while House Democrats have renounced the memo with claims of factual inaccuracy.
-L4ZLEPOvcZV1tNw6E4o.foodForThought: How significant are the contents of the Nunes memo? To what extent is the memo damaging to the FBI or the Republican and Democratic parties?
-L4ZLEPOvcZV1tNw6E4o.name: The Nunes Memo

-L4d9Sty4yLMrd917BVf.description:
• During his first State of the Union address, President Trump announced that he would be instructing U.S. Secretary of Defense James Mattis to keep Guantanamo Bay open. Trump also stated he would pursue the detainment of more terrorists at the prison camp.
  • The move is a reversal from the Obama administration's policy towards Guantanamo. Obama signed an order calling for the closure of Guantanamo Bay in 2009; however, he was unable to close the facility during his administration.
-L4d9Sty4yLMrd917BVf.foodForThought: Is Guantanamo Bay effective in helping fight terrorism? Does the use of the facility affect the United States' leadership on human rights issues?
-L4d9Sty4yLMrd917BVf.name: Should Guantanamo Bay Stay Open?

-L4iXiGGl26lobQc6shp.description:
• Over the past few days, stock markets has taken a significant hit. Last Friday, market indexes began falling sharply and then, things got worse. On Monday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) fell more than 1,100 points which represents the worst single-day point decline in its history. The S&P500 fell 4.1%, the worst percentage drop in six years.
  • While there is no broad consensus on a single trigger that led to the market sell-off, some experts suggest that concerns over future interest rate increases may have played a role.
  • Stocks rebounded slightly on Tuesday, with the S&P gaining 1.7% and the DJIA gaining 2.3%.
-L4iXiGGl26lobQc6shp.foodForThought: Should recent market volatility be a cause of concern? What, if anything, does it indicate about the state of the U.S. economy?
-L4iXiGGl26lobQc6shp.name: The Stock Market's Wild Ride...

-L4o7AYP7vAaX0D9To2u.description:
• On Wednesday afternoon, Senate leaders struck an ambitious two-year budget deal in an attempt to avoid another government shutdown, which would begin at midnight on Thursday.
  • The budget deal, which includes increased military spending as well as funding for disaster relief, children’s health care, and combating the opioid addiction, was cited as a victory by both Senate Majority and Minority Leaders Mitch McConnell and Chuck Schumer, who called it “a significant agreement”, and “the first green shoots of bipartisanship”, respectively.
  • The deal has drawn polarized responses from other congressional lawmakers. It does not include any legislation related to DACA, which has been a requisite component for Democrats.
  • The House will be the next step for the budget deal, where it could face significant opposition. At the same time as the plan was unveiled by Senate leaders, House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi was in the midst of a record setting eight-hour filibuster-like protest speech on the House floor, demanding legislative action on DACA.
  • Some Republican members of congress have also voiced opposition to the deal, stating it betrays the GOP’s fiscally conservative values.
-L4o7AYP7vAaX0D9To2u.foodForThought: Will Congress pass the budget deal in time to prevent another government shutdown? What are the advantages and disadvantages of the deal?
-L4o7AYP7vAaX0D9To2u.name: Is the Budget Deal a Good One?

-L4rpY7t8w5b8m3vnpu2.description:
• On Tuesday, Elon Musk's SpaceX successfully debuted its newest rocket called the Falcon Heavy.
  • The reusable rocket, believed to be the world's most powerful, carried a red Tesla Roadster as its mock payload during its widely-publicized test launch.
  • The Falcon Heavy is considered to be a major breakthrough in rocket technology. It has twice the lift capacity of the biggest rocket in America's existing fleet but costs just 1/4 as much.
  • SpaceX is a private space company founded by Elon Musk, a mercurial billionaire who has been vocal about his desire to colonize Mars. Musk is also the CEO and co-founder of Tesla.
-L4rpY7t8w5b8m3vnpu2.foodForThought: What does the launch of the Falcon Heavy mean for the future of space exploration?
-L4rpY7t8w5b8m3vnpu2.name: SpaceX and the Future of Space...
-L4rpY7t8w5b8m3vnpu2.shortTitle: Space X's Successful Falcon Heavy Launch

-L56zKlMWcF_8ZV20wDP.description:
• On Saturday, President Trump caused a stir when he tweeted, "Peoples lives are being shattered and destroyed by a mere allegation. Some are true and some are false. Some are old and some are new. There is no recovery for someone falsely accused – life and career are gone. Is there no such thing any longer as Due Process?"
  • This tweet represents one of the President's most direct remarks on the U.S.' national reckoning with sexual harassment and abuse.
  • Although this tweet did not specific names, it was published a few days after two former White House staffers, David Sorensen and Rob Porter, resigned due to accusations of domestic violence.
-L56zKlMWcF_8ZV20wDP.foodForThought: What does due process mean in the #MeToo era? How should Americans react to the President's recent tweet on the subject?
-L56zKlMWcF_8ZV20wDP.name: What Does Due Process Mean in the #MeToo Era?

-L5CV3lGUNU-KI7eMTIf.description:
• The Winter Olympics opened on Friday in PyeongChang, South Korea.
  • The Opening Ceremony was noteworthy for many reasons, including the fact that athletes from North and South Korea walked out together under one flag.
  • Interactions between world leaders were closely watched. U.S. Vice President Mike Pence and Kim Yo-jong, the younger sister of Kim Jong-un, drew particular attention. Pence did not interact with Kim Yo-jong and did not stand when the unified Korean team entered the stadium. Media outlets characterized this behavior in very different manners.
-L5CV3lGUNU-KI7eMTIf.foodForThought: Was Vice President Pence's interaction with Kim Yo-jong a net positive or negative for U.S. diplomacy? Did the media err in its coverage of North Korea?
-L5CV3lGUNU-KI7eMTIf.name: Propaganda & Diplomacy at the Olympics...

-L5GS8E8ADYV1cBAmPGg.description:
• On Monday, President Trump unveiled his infrastructure plan as part of a broader $4.4 trillion budget proposal. 
  • His plan proposes the use of $200 billion in federal funds over the next 10 years, with half of the funds going towards incentives for local and state governments and the other half going towards loans, grants and bonds.
  • The plan proposes limitations on many of the environmental and regulatory hurdles typically faced by new infrastructure projects.
  • The premise of the infrastructure plan is that $200 billion in federal spending will lead to total infrastructure investments of $1.5 trillion.
-L5GS8E8ADYV1cBAmPGg.foodForThought: Are public-private partnerships more or less effective than public-run projects? Is the infrastructure plan realistic?
-L5GS8E8ADYV1cBAmPGg.name: Pros & Cons of the Infrastructure Plan...

-L5LQIoB489LliLBnY4b.description:
• White House Chief of Staff John Kelly is facing high levels of scrutiny for his perceived mishandling of domestic abuse allegations against former White House Staff Secretary Rob Porter.
  • Last week, after accusations against Porter were made public by both of Porter's ex-wives, Kelly stood by and endorsed his former aide. Then, after Porter's resignation, Kelly shared that he was "shocked" to learn of the allegations. Soon after, reports surfaced that because Porter failed an initial security clearance investigation, Kelly may have known about the domestic abuse allegations for months.
  • President Trump recently shared that he is “totally opposed to domestic violence", but, for now, he is still expressing confidence in John Kelly.
-L5LQIoB489LliLBnY4b.foodForThought: Should John Kelly remain in his position as White House Chief of Staff?
-L5LQIoB489LliLBnY4b.name: Should John Kelly Keep His Job?
-L5LQIoB489LliLBnY4b.shortTitle: John Kelly's Position in the White House

-L5RmX5bMhuyaYytzirD.description:
• On Wednesday, a 19-year old gunman opened fire with an assault fire in a high school in Parkland, Florida. He killed 17 people and wounded more than a dozen others before he was arrested.
  • The gunman was a former student who had been expelled from the school for disciplinary reasons. He has since confessed to the shooting and has been charged with 17 counts of premeditated murder.
  • This was one of the most deadly public school shootings in modern U.S. history.
-L5RmX5bMhuyaYytzirD.foodForThought: Why is it so difficult to have a conversation about guns in America? What, if anything, can be done to prevent future mass shootings?
-L5RmX5bMhuyaYytzirD.name: Let's Talk About Guns...

-L5lO51g2y8fzXUAjtzw.description:
• Last Friday, Special Counsel Robert Mueller charged 13 Russian individuals and 3 organizations with interfering in US politics by conducting "information warfare against the United States of America."
  • Mueller's 37-page indictment describes how the Russian government worked to sow division among Americans by exploiting societal rifts. The accused organizations and individuals were charged with creating false U.S. personas, operating social media pages and groups designed to attract U.S. audiences, and interfering with the U.S. political system.
  • Reportedly, Facebook cooperated with Mueller and supplied much of the Russian-placed material that was included in Friday's indictment.
  • Over the weekend, President Trump reacted to the indictments by publishing a stream of tweets and reiterating that "there is no collusion."
-L5lO51g2y8fzXUAjtzw.foodForThought: What are the political and national security implications of Mueller's 37-page indictment?
-L5lO51g2y8fzXUAjtzw.name: Do Mueller's Indictments Change Anything?

-L5qc3p2pNpX3ZyJHUHq.description:
• This past Thursday in Congress, a series of immigration bills that would address the issues of DACA and border security failed to pass the Senate, falling short of the 60 votes needed. 
  • A bipartisan immigration bill that would have granted paths to citizenship for 1.8 million DREAMers while also committing $25 billion to funding the construction of a wall along the Mexican border was met with strong opposition from the White House for not being tough enough on legal immigration. ﻿The bill subsequently failed to pass the Senate, with a vote of 54-45.
  • President Trump backed a separate deal that would’ve extended federal deportation powers, ended the diversity visa lottery program, and made cuts in family-based legal migration. This bill also failed to pass, with a vote of 39-60. 
  • President Trump ended the DACA program back in September of 2017. The program was scheduled to officially expire March 5th, but two federal court judges have blocked Trump from ending the program.
-L5qc3p2pNpX3ZyJHUHq.foodForThought: What would a fair immigration compromise look like? Is a compromise a desirable outcome?
-L5qc3p2pNpX3ZyJHUHq.name: Multiple Immigration Bills Fail to Pass the Senate...

-L5vi7JDcIna8Kfv9kup.description:
• On Wednesday, a group of students from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, the site of a deadly school shooting last week in Parkland, Florida, marched on the state’s capital in Tallahassee. 
  • The march marked a day full of protests and attempts on the part of the students to meet with and persuade Florida lawmakers to pass stricter gun control legislation.
  • The protests extended beyond Florida, as students in many different states across the US staged school walk-outs and joined marches to voice their solidarity and urge the country’s government officials to change gun laws.
-L5vi7JDcIna8Kfv9kup.foodForThought: How should the country and the government respond to concerns voiced by Wednesday’s student demonstrations? Will the protests lead to legislative action on gun control?
-L5vi7JDcIna8Kfv9kup.name: Students' Call for Gun Control

-L632iP73C9aRnoYeFox.description:
• This past Wednesday, Billy Graham passed away at the age of 99. 
  • Graham was one of the most famous and influential Christian evangelical leaders of the 20th and 21st centuries, and was commonly referred to as “America’s Pastor.”
  • Graham met with presidents ranging from Harry Truman to Barack Obama and was a strong civil rights advocate throughout the 1950s and the 1960s.
-L632iP73C9aRnoYeFox.foodForThought: How will Billy Graham be remembered? What was the impact of his evangelical movement?
-L632iP73C9aRnoYeFox.name: What is Billy Graham's Legacy?

-L6Fe6zPQaO0OprNf71o.description:
• On Sunday night the Winter Olympics of 2018 were drawn to a close in Pyeongchang, South Korea.
  • Norway achieved particular olympic success, earning the most gold, silver, and bronze medals in the games. The United States had the 4th highest medal total, winning 9 gold, 8 silver, and and 8 bronze medals.
  • A large number of world and olympic records were set in different skating events in Pyeongchang.
  • Notable factors in both the anticipation and duration of the games included: developments in the relationship between North and South Korea and the decision to walk under a Korean Unification flag, the suspension of the Russian Olympic Committee and debated participation of Russian athletes after state-sponsored doping scandals and charges, and the NHL prohibition of league players from participating in Olympic ice hockey.
-L6Fe6zPQaO0OprNf71o.foodForThought: What are the major takeaways from this year’s Winter Olympics? What effect did various controversies have on the games?
-L6Fe6zPQaO0OprNf71o.name: International Reflections on the Winter Olympics

-L6KFe9pserVZVrCOQTU.description:
• After the Parkland shooting, many Americans took to social media to encourage corporations to cut ties with the National Rifle Association (NRA) using the #BoycottNRA hashtag.
  • In the wake of this movement, a number of businesses — including United Airlines, Delta Airlines, Hertz, Enterprise, Wyndham Hotels and Metlife — announced that they were ending their NRA discount programs and partnerships.
  • The NRA issued a statement sharply criticizing this corporate activism and many gun rights advocates encouraged Americans to #TweetYourNRAMembership over social media.
-L6KFe9pserVZVrCOQTU.foodForThought: Is it right or fair for corporations to sever ties with the NRA? Is this a business decision, a political decision, or both?
-L6KFe9pserVZVrCOQTU.name: Should Businesses Keep NRA Partnerships?

-L6P_fHNAk5t5DKyM-AN.description:
• On Monday, the U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear an appeal of a federal judge’s ruling that DACA must be kept in place. The appeal was submitted by the Trump administration.
  • The Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program was originally established by the Obama administration in 2012. It provides paths to citizenship for approximately 800,000 undocumented immigrants that came to the U.S. illegally as children.
  • President Trump ended the DACA program back in September of 2017, giving it a six month expiration date set for March 5th.
  • Since Trump’s decision to repeal DACA, two federal circuit court judges have ruled that Trump cannot legally end the program. 
  • With the Supreme Court’s decision to not hear the Trump administration’s appeal, California’s 9th Circuit Court of Appeals will hear the case.
-L6P_fHNAk5t5DKyM-AN.foodForThought: What does the Supreme Court’s decision mean for the future of the DREAMers? How should Congress act on the issue of DACA?
-L6P_fHNAk5t5DKyM-AN.name: The Supreme Court Declines To Hear DACA Appeal

-L6UgA-7xW4082Y6ozfW.description:
• Xi Jinping, President of the People's Republic of China and General Secretary of the Communist Party of China, currently occupies the highest offices of power for the state, party, and military of China. 
  • Since assuming power in 2012-2013, Xi has taken measures to centralize institutional power, enacted significant reforms, and developed a cult of personality to support his leadership.
  • On February 25th, a proposal for a new constitutional amendment surfaced in China’s state-sponsored news publications. The proposed amendment, put forth by the Communist Party of China Central Committee, removes the current two-term limit imposed on the presidential office, potentially extending Xi Jinping’s presidency beyond his current term, indefinitely.
-L6UgA-7xW4082Y6ozfW.foodForThought: What does it mean for the future of China if Xi Jinping is no longer bound by term limits? To what extent could the proposed amendment influence global relations?
-L6UgA-7xW4082Y6ozfW.img_attr: Prime Minister's Office, Government of India
-L6UgA-7xW4082Y6ozfW.mobile_img_attr: Prime Minister's Office, Government of India
-L6UgA-7xW4082Y6ozfW.name: No More Term Limits for China's Xi Jinping?

-L6Zh035-7Aw9gWxPiLB.description:
• During a bipartisan meeting to discuss gun control this past Wednesday, President Trump called on Congress to raise the minimum age to buy an assault weapon from 18 to 21 and to create a stronger, universal system of background checks for gun purchases.
  • In the meeting, Trump expressed his belief that guns should be taken from the mentally ill, stating “Take the guns first, go through due process second.”
  • Trump also stated his intent to sign an executive order banning “bump stocks," the device used by the Las Vegas shooter to convert his semiautomatic rifle into an automatic rifle. 
  • President Trump’s stances directly conflict with the political stances of the National Rifle Association (NRA). 
  • The timeline for any potential gun-related legislation remains unclear.
-L6Zh035-7Aw9gWxPiLB.foodForThought: Will President Trump play a role in bridging liberal and conservative stances on guns? What type of signal is he sending?
-L6Zh035-7Aw9gWxPiLB.name: President Trump's Stance on Guns

-L6odB7tSKaaVsiopHlw.description:
• On March 1st, President Trump announced his plan to impose new tariffs on all steel and aluminum imported into the United States from foreign countries.
  • The proposed tariffs are 25% on imported steel and 10% on imported aluminum. 
  • The plan to impose tariffs has drawn criticism from some Republican and Democratic lawmakers in the US and has generated international concern over global trade relations. Following the announcement, the stock market fell over 2%.
  • On Sunday night the Trump administration defended the plan and re-emphasized support for the tariffs.
-L6odB7tSKaaVsiopHlw.foodForThought: Will the proposed tariffs be good or bad for the US economy? How will the tariffs impact global trade relations?
-L6odB7tSKaaVsiopHlw.name: New Tariffs on Steel and Aluminum

-L6tmk8ZH7sm7FN2Znxw.description:
• On Sunday evening, Jimmy Kimmel hosted the 90th Academy Awards in the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles, CA.
  • During the ceremony, "The Shape of Water" won Best Picture and its director, Guillermo del Toro, won Best Director.
  • Frances McDormand won Best Actress for her work in the drama, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri, and Gary Oldman won Best Actor for portraying Winston Churchill in Darkest Hour.
  • The ceremony emphasized themes of inclusivity and diversity with many ads and speeches focused on empowering women and minority groups.
  • Initial estimates indicate that television ratings for these Oscars were at an all-time low.
-L6tmk8ZH7sm7FN2Znxw.foodForThought: Should the 2018 Academy Awards be classified as a success, failure or something in between? Did it handle topics like #MeToo and #OscarsSoWhite effectively?
-L6tmk8ZH7sm7FN2Znxw.name: What did people think of the 2018 Oscars?

-L7-btVOZ-97kowTDqll.description:
On Tuesday, a delegation of South Korean officials announced that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un expressed a willingness to negotiate with the United States.

According to these South Korean officials, North Korea might be willing to reduce or abandon its nuclear weapons program in exchange for things like sanctions relief and other concessions. Kim Jong Un apparently agreed to suspend all nuclear missile tests while diplomatic talks are under way.

A few weeks ago, the Trump administration announced a huge round of sanctions on North Korea. The administration says that these sanctions were the toughest ever imposed on another country.
-L7-btVOZ-97kowTDqll.foodForThought: Is North Korea truly willing to go through the process of denuclearization? How should the U.S. respond to these reports?
-L7-btVOZ-97kowTDqll.name: Is North Korea Willing to Denuclearize?
-L7-btVOZ-97kowTDqll.shortTitle: Is North Korea Willing to Denuclearize?

-L74fDrAowj8cQOaDlPL.description:
• On Tuesday, state lawmakers in West Virginia passed legislation that gives a 5% raise to teachers and other public employees.
  • Before this pay raise was announced, teachers in West Virginia had been on strike for 9 days. This state-wide teacher strike kept 227,000 students out of school across all 55 counties.
  • According to the National Education Association, at the time of the strike, West Virginia teacher pay ranked 46th among of the 50 US states at $45,783.
-L74fDrAowj8cQOaDlPL.foodForThought: Do unions ultimately lead to better or worse pay for educators? Was the teachers' strike justifiable?
-L74fDrAowj8cQOaDlPL.name: The End of the West Virginia Teachers' Strike

-L77XZFFIuRN0wapu4dB.description:
• On Tuesday, Gary Cohn resigned from his position as President Trump’s top economic adviser.
  • Cohn’s decision was announced after President Trump declared his plan to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, a move that Cohn opposed. Cohn had previously stated that he may resign if Trump went through with the tariff plans.
  • On Thursday, Trump spoke about Cohn at a Cabinet meeting, stating, “He may be a globalist, but I still like him.” Trump also said that Cohn could return to the White House in the future.
-L77XZFFIuRN0wapu4dB.foodForThought: What is Gary Cohn's legacy from his time in the White House? What impact will his departure have on the Trump administration’s economic policies?
-L77XZFFIuRN0wapu4dB.name: The Impact of Gary Cohn's Resignation
-L77XZFFIuRN0wapu4dB.shortTitle: The Impact of Gary Cohn's Resignation

-L7NOqnaRcKWB41rSrKH.description:
• Last Wednesday, the State Legislature of Florida passed a bill with new gun restrictions, which was then signed into law on Friday afternoon by Florida Governor Rick Scott.
  • The new law is named for the high school in Parkland where a recent deadly mass shooting led to increased public pressure for gun control in the state of Florida and beyond. 
  • The gun control measures contained in the legislation include banning bump stocks, raising the minimum age to purchase a firearm from 18 to 21, and enforcing a three-day waiting period for gun buyers. Additionally, the law includes increased funding for school security, expands mental health services, and allows for the arming of some school employees through a special program designed to arm and train school personnel on a volunteer basis.
  • Hours after the bill was signed, the NRA filed a lawsuit in an attempt to block Florida from enforcing the new law. The NRA claims the law violates constitutional rights, focusing particularly on the age restriction provision.
-L7NOqnaRcKWB41rSrKH.foodForThought: What are the pros and cons of the new gun control law passed in Florida? Will the legislation have an impact on the gun control debate at the national level?
-L7NOqnaRcKWB41rSrKH.name: Florida’s Gun Control Legislation

-L7RjqEoTMRBgRIvDsDt.description:
• Today Pennsylvania's 18th congressional district will hold a special election to determine who will succeed Representative Tim Murphy. Murphy resigned in October 2017 after reports emerged that he encouraged his lover to abort her pregnancy.
  • The Democratic candidate is 33-year old Conor Lamb, a veteran Marine and former prosecutor.
  • The Republican candidate is Rick Saccone, who currently serves as a State representative in the Pennsylvania House of Representatives.
  • President Trump carried the district by 20 points in the 2016 presidential election.
-L7RjqEoTMRBgRIvDsDt.foodForThought: Which candidate would be a better pick for Pennsylvania's 18th district? What are the implications of this race for future electoral prospects?
-L7RjqEoTMRBgRIvDsDt.img_attr: Peters Township Community TV, 39th District Press Photo
-L7RjqEoTMRBgRIvDsDt.name: Special Election in Pennsylvania

-L7XZ9CWqDG5bKJ8an5j.description:
• On Tuesday, President Trump announced he would be firing Rex Tillerson from his position as the U.S. Secretary of State.
  • Trump also announced that the current CIA Director, Mike Pompeo, would be Tillerson’s successor.
-L7XZ9CWqDG5bKJ8an5j.foodForThought: Why did President Trump decide to fire Tillerson? How will Tillerson’s departure affect U.S. diplomacy with other nations?
-L7XZ9CWqDG5bKJ8an5j.name: President Trump Fires Rex Tillerson as Secretary of State

-L7ekFxWTpuvszCwzhp6.description:
• The Majority members of the House of Representatives Intelligence Committee announced the close of a year-long investigation into Russian interference in the presidential election of 2016.
  • The committee concluded that there was "no evidence of collusion, coordination, or conspiracy between the Trump campaign and the Russians."
  • The sudden closure has further deepened the partisan divide between the majority and minority members of the intelligence committee, and has generated swift criticism from Democratic representatives.
  • The Senate Intelligence Committee investigation and Robert Mueller's special counsel investigation remain open.
-L7ekFxWTpuvszCwzhp6.foodForThought: What is the significance of the House intel committee ending their investigation? Will the Senate intel committee investigation and Mueller's special counsel investigation end in similar results?
-L7ekFxWTpuvszCwzhp6.name: House Committee Ends Russia Investigation

-L7hF7zCbRLyYqDM3ION.description:
• On Tuesday voters in the Pennsylvania 18th district elected Democrat Conor Lamb to the House of Representatives over Republican candidate Rick Saccone. 
  • The district, which Trump won by 20 percentage points in 2016, has a history of voting red.
  • The race was tight, with results being too close to call well into Wednesday morning, and eventually yielding a margin of victory of under 1,000 votes in favor of Lamb.
-L7hF7zCbRLyYqDM3ION.foodForThought: What do the special election results in Pennsylvania mean for the GOP? What do they mean for the Democratic Party?
-L7hF7zCbRLyYqDM3ION.name: Takeaways from Pennsylvania Special Election...

-L7z4E3batN9P-1xt7N-.description:
• On Friday, U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions fired Andrew McCabe, the former Deputy Director of the FBI, two days before McCabe would have entered into retirement.
  • McCabe stepped down from his position as Deputy Director of the FBI back in January amid allegations that he had misled Justice Department investigators about his role in the FBI’s Clinton email investigation.
  • Sessions justified his firing of McCabe based on a report from the Justice Department’s Inspector General, which allegedly shows that McCabe "lacked candor" in his statements to investigators about leaks to the media. The report has not yet been released to the public.
  • McCabe was the source of heavy criticism from President Trump in the months leading up to his firing. In a public statement, McCabe claimed that his firing is part of an attempt to discredit the Special Counsel’s investigation of Russian interference in the 2016 election.
-L7z4E3batN9P-1xt7N-.foodForThought: Was it fair for Sessions to fire McCabe? How will McCabe's firing impact ongoing FBI investigations?
-L7z4E3batN9P-1xt7N-.mobile_img_attr: U. S. Federal Bureau of Investigation
-L7z4E3batN9P-1xt7N-.name: Jeff Sessions Fires Andrew McCabe

-L806afvLwJPsdHvc6Kt.description:
• The NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament, commonly referred to as "March Madness" kicked off last Tuesday, March 13th. The tournament has produced some stunning upsets, including No. 16 UMBC's upset over top-ranked Virginia.
  • Off the court, the NCAA is coming under renewed pressure to consider paying student-athletes.
  • The NCAA, which is officially a non-profit, made over $1B in revenue last year with the majority coming from the men's basketball tournament. The top-paid men's basketball coach, Duke's Mike Krzyzewski, makes $8.9M per year.
  • A recent FBI investigation revealed widespread corruption related to recruiting tactics and exposed many top programs for bribing players to join teams.
-L806afvLwJPsdHvc6Kt.foodForThought: Is it necessary to reform the NCAA? Is it a good or bad idea to pay student athletes?
-L806afvLwJPsdHvc6Kt.name: Should NCAA Athletes Get Paid?

-L85szck0H7sOpXXc38I.description:
• Over the weekend Facebook banned the data firm Cambridge Analytica from using its social media platform. 
  • Cambridge Analytica is a company that specializes in data collection and analysis for political campaign purposes, and has worked with multiple Republican campaigns in the US, including the 2016 Trump presidential campaign.
  • Facebook terminated their relationship with Cambridge Analytica after reports surfaced that the company improperly acquired personal information from 50 million+ Facebook accounts and used the harvested data without permission.
  • Yesterday, Cambridge Analytica suspended its CEO, Alexander Nix, amidst the public scrutiny garnered by the scandal. As of Wednesday morning, Facebook's stock price had fallen by over 6%.
-L85szck0H7sOpXXc38I.foodForThought: What is the significance of the alleged data misuse by Cambridge Analytica? What are the implications for Facebook, the Trump administration, and the American people?
-L85szck0H7sOpXXc38I.name: The Cambridge Analytica Data Scandal

-L8AXNjlhDCfGI-vH7jd.description:
• Over the past few weeks, an alleged affair between Donald Trump and porn star Stormy Daniels (real name: Stephanie Clifford) has maintained a place in news headlines.
  • Allegedly, Daniels and Trump began their affair in 2006 and continued it until mid-2008. Donald Trump married his wife, Melania, in 2015.
  • Trump's lawyer, Michael Cohen, admitted to paying Daniels $130K days before the 2016 election for a non-disclosure agreement. Some are raising questions as to whether this payment should be considered as an illicit campaign expense.
-L8AXNjlhDCfGI-vH7jd.foodForThought: How significant is the alleged Stormy Daniels affair and hush money? How should evangelicals react to the story?
-L8AXNjlhDCfGI-vH7jd.name: The Stormy Daniels Saga

-L8FDiI_Zj2YRq_V8_VG.description:
• On Thursday, President Trump signed an executive memorandum that imposes new tariffs on $60 billion worth of Chinese goods, as well as restrictions on Chinese investment in the United States.
  • The move was made in retaliation to years of alleged intellectual property theft on China’s behalf. A review started by the White House this past August found that China has engaged in several “unfair” trade practices, such as forcing U.S. companies to divulge technological secrets and sponsoring / conducting cyberattacks.
  • In response, China announced that it may raise tariffs on American pork, aluminum and other goods. China has compiled a list of 128 U.S. products it will target.
  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed 720 points lower on Thursday, following Trump’s announcement of the tariffs.
-L8FDiI_Zj2YRq_V8_VG.foodForThought: How will these new tariffs affect U.S. and Chinese industries? Did President Trump's tariffs kick off a trade war?
-L8FDiI_Zj2YRq_V8_VG.name: A U.S. Trade War with China?
-L8FDiI_Zj2YRq_V8_VG.shortTitle: A U.S. Trade War with China?

-L8V-2kWh9VNiZp7Dn1D.description:
• This Saturday, hundreds of thousands of protesters participated in the student-led demonstration March for Our Lives in Washington DC. With over 800 sister marches in the US and abroad, it marked one of the largest student protests in US history.
  • The event was organized in the wake of the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting in Parkland, FL, in partnership with the nonprofit Everytown for Gun Safety.
  • Protesters called for stronger gun control legislation, and urged congressional action on issues like universal background checks, closing the gun show loophole, and banning the sale of assault weapons.
-L8V-2kWh9VNiZp7Dn1D.foodForThought: What is the significance of Saturday's March for Our Lives? Will it lead to legislative action on gun control?
-L8V-2kWh9VNiZp7Dn1D.name: March for Our Lives

-L8_OD7V2hdHOl3YF9fz.description:
• Many Western allies have expelled Russian diplomats in response to an alleged incident where Russia used a nerve-agent poison on a former Russian spy in the UK. Moscow has denied its involvement in the poisoning.
  • On Monday, President Trump ordered the expulsion of sixty Russian diplomats in the US and closed the Russian consulate in Seattle. The Seattle consulate is located near a US submarine base and Boeing headquarters.
  • The US announcement comes at a time when Russia is mourning the deaths of dozens of children who died in a shopping mall fire in Kemerovo.
-L8_OD7V2hdHOl3YF9fz.foodForThought: What is the international context behind the expulsion of Russian diplomats from the US and European countries? What is the global significance of these actions?
-L8_OD7V2hdHOl3YF9fz.name: Should Western Countries Expel Russian Diplomats?

-L8chNXcu-2snLVH3CH1.description:
• Last Thursday, President Trump announced that H.R. McMaster would be resigning from his post as national security advisor and that John Bolton would be his replacement.
  • Bolton is a former ambassador to the United Nations, serving from 2005-2006 as a recess appointment during the Bush administration. Bolton also previously served in the state department under former President George H.W. Bush.
-L8chNXcu-2snLVH3CH1.foodForThought: How will Bolton's appointment influence American foreign policy? How influential will he be in the Trump administration?
-L8chNXcu-2snLVH3CH1.name: Bolton Replaces McMaster as National Security Advisor
-L8chNXcu-2snLVH3CH1.shortTitle: McMaster Is Out, Bolton Is In

-L8jNOhyCpbrY8DpSVdI.description:
• This week, the Trump administration announced that it will ask 2020 census respondents whether they are U.S. citizens.
  • This inclusion of the citizenship question could have big political and administrative implications, particularly if, as some people claim, it dissuades immigrants from answering the census.
  • The citizenship question was included in the census prior to 1950 and some say that it helps to enforce the Voting Rights Act.
  • The objective of the census, which takes place every ten years, is to count every resident in the country. Based on these tallies, the U.S. government allocates congressional seats and distributes billions in funding.
-L8jNOhyCpbrY8DpSVdI.foodForThought: What are the pros and cons of the proposed citizenship question? What are the political and administrative implications?
-L8jNOhyCpbrY8DpSVdI.name: Should the 2020 Census have a Citizenship Question?

-L8rT77t6qxARJKvOSuL.description:
• Yesterday, President Trump tweeted, "I have stated my concerns with Amazon long before the Election. Unlike others, they pay little or no taxes to state & local governments, use our Postal System as their Delivery Boy (causing tremendous loss to the U.S.), and are putting many thousands of retailers out of business!"
  • Since the tweet was published, many people have attempted to explain which of the President's arguments are correct and which may not paint the full picture.
  • The broader tech industry (Facebook, Twitter, Nvidia, etc.) is in the midst of a market sell-off with many wondering whether government regulation is around the corner.
-L8rT77t6qxARJKvOSuL.foodForThought: Is President Trump right to raise concerns about Amazon? Can, and should, anything be done to rein in the tech giant?
-L8rT77t6qxARJKvOSuL.name: Does Amazon Need to be Reined In?
-L8rT77t6qxARJKvOSuL.shortTitle: Does Amazon Need to be Reined In?

-L930cFlzOnex5et5Nd3.description:
• The nation of Syria has been engulfed in civil war and unrest since 2011. The violent conflict has resulted in a major humanitarian and refugee crisis in the region.
  • The United States led an international military intervention in Syria in 2014 and has since maintained an active, open-ended military position in the country with the goal of removing Syrian president Bashar Assad.
  • Last week, President Trump stated in a speech in Ohio that the US military will be "coming out of Syria very soon."
-L930cFlzOnex5et5Nd3.foodForThought: What is the best approach to take in Syria? Should the US maintain a presence in the country?
-L930cFlzOnex5et5Nd3.name: Should the US leave Syria?

-L9CwbJihU5yavObY3HQ.description:
Fifty years ago, on April 4th, 1968, Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated on the 2nd-floor balcony of the Lorraine Motel in Memphis, Tennessee. King, a legendary civil rights icon and a Nobel Peace Prize recipient, was in Memphis to support the city's striking sanitation workers.

The night before his assassination, King gave a speech where he famously declared, "And I've looked over, and I've seen the Promised Land. I may not get there with you. But I want you to know tonight, that we, as a people, will get to the Promised Land."

Across the nation, Americans are reflecting on King's legacy, the current state of race relations, and our nation's journey towards the "Promised Land."
-L9CwbJihU5yavObY3HQ.foodForThought: How should we think about Martin Lut﻿her King Jr.'s legacy 50 years after his assassination? Are U.S. race relations today better, worse, or the same as race relations in 1968?
-L9CwbJihU5yavObY3HQ.mobile_img_attr: Lyndon Baines Johnson Library and Museum
-L9CwbJihU5yavObY3HQ.name: Reflections on Race, 50 Years After MLK

-L9LoANJCLyJr8ytnwoi.description:
• Tuesday night, The White House announced that President Trump plans to deploy the National Guard to the southern border with Mexico, stating that the deployment is part of a strategy to combat “the growing influx of illegal immigration, drugs and violent gang members from Central America.”
  • The announcement comes amid reports that a caravan of over 1,000 Central Americans is heading through Mexico to the United States, planning to either seek asylum in the U.S. from crime at home or to sneak in undetected.
  • President Trump first responded to these reports on Sunday via twitter, declaring that there was “NO MORE DACA DEAL,” while also threatening to pull out of NAFTA if Mexico didn’t step up efforts to curb the flow of crime and illegal immigration to the U.S.
  • President Trump has also reportedly floated the idea of using U.S. Military funding to pay for construction of a wall along the southern border with Mexico, after the Omnibus spending bill did not include any border wall funding.
-L9LoANJCLyJr8ytnwoi.foodForThought: Does the United States need tighter border security? What is the significance of this latest executive action when it comes to the border between the US and Mexico?
-L9LoANJCLyJr8ytnwoi.img_attr: Tomas Castelazo, www.tomascastelazo.com / Wikimedia Commons / CC BY-SA 4.0
-L9LoANJCLyJr8ytnwoi.img_attr_url: Tomas Castelazo, www.tomascastelazo.com / Wikimedia Commons / CC BY-SA 4.0
-L9LoANJCLyJr8ytnwoi.name: Plans to Deploy National Guard to Mexican Border
-L9LoANJCLyJr8ytnwoi.shortTitle: Trump Deploys National Guard to Border

-L9O4-oMg9yaC0vhNpnj.description:
• Scott Pruitt, the Administrator of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is in hot water for a number of controversial decisions.
  • He paid $50 / night to rent a room on Capital Hill from the wife of an energy lobbyist, he gave large raises to his top aides without going through traditional approval channels, spent over $100K on luxury air travel, and installed a secure phone booth in his office. In his role, Pruitt has held extensive meetings with industry representatives while spending less time with environmental activists.
  • Many are calling for Pruitt's ouster. However, President Trump and many Republicans have come to Pruitt's defense and argue that Pruitt has been highly effective in his role.
-L9O4-oMg9yaC0vhNpnj.foodForThought: Should Scott Pruitt's actions be classified as scandals? Should he remain in his role as Administrator of the EPA?
-L9O4-oMg9yaC0vhNpnj.name: Scott Pruitt's Controversial EPA Tenure

-L9bHZKRDXMpH9m1-dAM.description:
• Silent Sam is a statue on the UNC campus that depicts a Confederate soldier. 
  • Erected in 1913 by the United Daughters of the Confederacy, the statue was dedicated to the UNC students and alumni who lost their lives while fighting for the Confederate Army during the Civil War. The “silent” in Silent Sam refers to the statue’s lack of cartridge box, meaning the soldier cannot fire his weapon.
  • The statue has drawn criticism and controversy, as some consider Silent Sam a racist symbol. 
  • The debate surrounding Silent Sam intensified after the events in Charlottesville this past August, with students organizing protests and boycotts intended to pressure UNC into removing the statue. The UNC administration has said that a law prevents the school from taking action to remove the statue.
-L9bHZKRDXMpH9m1-dAM.foodForThought: Should UNC remove the statue of Silent Sam? If so, what should be done with it?
-L9bHZKRDXMpH9m1-dAM.name: What should UNC do about Silent Sam?
-L9bHZKRDXMpH9m1-dAM.shortTitle: What should UNC do about Silent Sam?

-L9hSpt_t2Gl--w7C2M6.description:
• Late on Saturday, a suspected chemical weapons attack in Douma, Syria killed over 60 people and injured over 1,000.
  • Many groups believe that Syrian President Bashar al-Assad is behind the attack.
  • On Monday, U.S. President Donald Trump condemned the chemical attack, placed some blame on Russian President Vladimir Putin, and promised that there would be a "big price to pay."
  • Last week, President Trump said that he was interested in taking the U.S. military out of Syria very soon, but his stance could change due to recent events.
-L9hSpt_t2Gl--w7C2M6.foodForThought: How should President Trump and the U.S. military respond to the chemical attack in Syria? How will this response fit into a broader strategy?
-L9hSpt_t2Gl--w7C2M6.name: How should the U.S. respond to Syria's chemical attack?

-L9mxXWCZWN8FvDGQRsr.description:
• On Monday, the FBI raided the office, home, and hotel room of President Trump's attorney Michael Cohen.
  • The raid, which required approval from senior officials at the Department of Justice, came at the request of the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York and was based on a tip from special counsel Robert Mueller.
  • Mueller will be able to use any information generated by the raid in his own investigation.
  • The reason for the raid has not been confirmed, but many news sites report that the FBI obtained documents related to the $130,000 payment to Stormy Daniels. Some, including President Trump, suggest that this raid represented a severe breach of attorney-client privilege.
-L9mxXWCZWN8FvDGQRsr.foodForThought: What does this raid mean for different parties? When is it acceptable to breach attorney-client privilege?
-L9mxXWCZWN8FvDGQRsr.name: Was the FBI Raid on Cohen Justified?

-L9rZcbz3mtMIHF8gW65.description:
• Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg just completed a two-day Congressional hearing. He faced over ten hours of questioning from over 100 members of Congress.
  • Lawmakers spent much of the hearing questioning Zuckerberg about how Facebook is protecting user data, especially in light of the recent revelations that Cambridge Analytica gained inappropriate access to data from ~87 million users. Congress also pressed Zuckerberg on the issue of regulation.
  • During the hearing, Zuckerberg frequently told lawmakers that he was unable to answer the specific question at hand and he promised that his team would get back to them later.
  • Facebook's stock surged during Zuckerberg's testimony.
-L9rZcbz3mtMIHF8gW65.foodForThought: Who had the upper hand in the congressional hearing? Zuckerberg or Congress? Does Facebook need to be regulated, and if so, how?
-L9rZcbz3mtMIHF8gW65.name: Mark Zuckerberg's Congressional Hearings...

-L9zVkAl41S_9V4c3hR6.description:
• On Wednesday, Paul Ryan, the current Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, announced he would not seek re-election in November, and that he would instead retire from his career in politics.
  • Paul Ryan has been the U.S. representative for Wisconsin’s 1st district since 1999.
  • He ran as Mitt Romney’s Vice Presidential candidate against Barack Obama and Joe Biden in 2012, and succeeded John Boehner as the Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives in October 2015.
-L9zVkAl41S_9V4c3hR6.foodForThought: What is Paul Ryan's legacy from his time in Congress? How will Ryan's retirement affect the Republicans' electoral prospects in the 2018 midterms?
-L9zVkAl41S_9V4c3hR6.name: Paul Ryan Announces His Retirement From Congress...

-LABSVXBsktnVC-q-7ra.description:
• Former FBI Director James Comey has re-entered the political arena with a new memoir entitled "A Higher Loyalty," set to be released this Tuesday.
  • To promote the book, Comey appeared on ABC News for a highly-publicized interview, which aired Sunday night. In the interview, Comey criticizes the leadership and character of President Trump, asserting he is dishonest, immoral, and unfit for the office.
  • President Trump fired back over the weekend via Twitter, calling Comey a "leaker," "liar" and a "slimeball," denying he asked Comey for personal loyalty, and suggesting Comey should be prosecuted for his actions in a series of tweets.
-LABSVXBsktnVC-q-7ra.foodForThought: How significant are Comey's recent claims and actions? Will there be political repercussions for President Trump or the major parties?
-LABSVXBsktnVC-q-7ra.img_attr: Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons
-LABSVXBsktnVC-q-7ra.name: James Comey and his new Memoir
-LABSVXBsktnVC-q-7ra.shortTitle: James Comey and his new Memoir

-LAG0Kousm0DeTasAsIA.description:
• Over the weekend, the United States, Britain, and France launched over 100 missiles targeting three chemical weapons facilities in Syria.
  • The missile launch was made in retaliation of the Syrian government's alleged use of chemical weapons last week.
  • The Syrian and Russian governments have sharply condemned the missile attack, calling it an illegal act of aggression.
  • Meanwhile, President Trump has declared the attack a success and stated, "Mission accomplished" over Twitter.
-LAG0Kousm0DeTasAsIA.foodForThought: If you were in President Trump's, PM May's, or President Macron's shoes, would you have executed the missile strike on Syria? If not, what alternative would you propose?
-LAG0Kousm0DeTasAsIA.name: Were the Syria Missile Strikes a Success?

-LANvVwaYPvWU28nfcvi.description:
• Yesterday, April 17th, was Tax Day.
  • In honor of the often dreaded, but important, date, President Trump penned an op-ed in the USA Today in which he touted the successes of his administration's tax reform efforts. Many others provided commentary that offered other unique assessments.
  • The tax bill, which was passed this past December, included a cut in the corporate tax rate from 35% to 21% and provided tax cuts to around 80% of Americans (according to the non-partisan Tax Policy Center).
-LANvVwaYPvWU28nfcvi.foodForThought: What is your evaluation of the GOP Tax Bill at this stage? Which aspects of the bill have been successful, which have not, and which are too early to assess?
-LANvVwaYPvWU28nfcvi.name: Tax Reform Reflections on Tax Day
-LANvVwaYPvWU28nfcvi.shortTitle: Tax Reform Reflections on Tax Day

-LAYMDAgYXeguQtXlJH9.description:
• Starbucks just announced that it will close 8,000 of its company-owned U.S. stores on May 29th so that its employees can undergo a mandatory racial tolerance training.
  • The company is in the midst of a public relations crisis due to an incident at one of its Philadelphia locations last week. Two black men in the store asked to use the bathroom but were refused because they had not made a purchase. After the men refused to leave, a manager called 911 and the black men walked out in handcuffs.
  • The event was filmed and went viral. Some are calling for a #BoycottStarbucks movement and many have protested the incident.
  • This isn't the first time Starbucks has been at the center of a discussion on race. In 2015, the company launched a "Race Together" campaign that aimed to facilitate conversations about high-profile police shootings of unarmed black men. This campaign was ended after intense social media backlash.
-LAYMDAgYXeguQtXlJH9.foodForThought: How should people react to the recent arrests of two black men at Starbucks? Should Americans #BoycottStarbucks or has "PC culture" gone too far?
-LAYMDAgYXeguQtXlJH9.name: Tense Times at Starbucks...

-LAkh8mLK1KHgSc_2OZZ.description:
• On Friday, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un announced intentions to suspend nuclear tests and intercontinental ballistic missile launches as well as dismantle a nuclear test site in the country.
  • The announcement comes ahead of two much-anticipated upcoming summits: the first being between the leaders of North and South Korea this coming week, and the second being a future meeting with King Jong Un and President Trump.
  • Some believe Friday's news is an optimistic sign that North Korea is open to full denuclearization, while others view it as a publicity stunt with deceptive intentions.
-LAkh8mLK1KHgSc_2OZZ.foodForThought: What is the significance of Friday's announcement from Kim Jong Un? Is there hope for the approaching summits when it comes to denuclearization of North Korea?
-LAkh8mLK1KHgSc_2OZZ.name: Negotiations with North Korea

-LAsm5PM7bza1lK-DYqK.description:
• Sean Hannity is a conservative political commentator and host of Hannity on Fox News. 
  • Recently on air, Hannity discussed and criticized the federal search warrant executed for the office and residence of Michael Cohen, President Trump’s personal lawyer.
  • It was later revealed by Michael Cohen’s lawyers in court that Hannity was also a client of Cohen, a fact which Hannity had not disclosed during his coverage. 
  • Hannity has downplayed the connection, maintaining his relationship with Cohen was limited to a few conversations concerning real estate.
-LAsm5PM7bza1lK-DYqK.foodForThought: What is the extent and significance of Sean Hannity's professional relationship with Michael Cohen? Is it a big deal that Hannity did not disclose the relationship on air?
-LAsm5PM7bza1lK-DYqK.name: Sean Hannity Comes Under Fire...

-LAtxpk9OPuC614H-hc0.description:
• On Wednesday, April 25th, the Supreme Court will hear oral arguments for Trump v Hawaii, the case at the center of the legal challenges to President Trump’s travel ban, and the final case of the court’s nine-month term. 
  • The executive action in question is the third iteration of the president’s travel ban, which restricts travel to the United States from eight countries: Chad, Iran, Libya, North Korea, Somalia, Syria, Venezuela, and Yemen.  
  • The Supreme Court is expected to reach a final decision regarding the travel ban by the end of June.
-LAtxpk9OPuC614H-hc0.foodForThought: Should the Supreme Court uphold President Trump's travel ban, or strike it down? What are the consequences of either decision?
-LAtxpk9OPuC614H-hc0.name: The Supreme Court and the Travel Ban
-LAtxpk9OPuC614H-hc0.shortTitle: The Supreme Court and the Travel Ban

-LAxef7oFMAVoOIagO0H.description:
• On Monday, the Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted along party lines to approve Mike Pompeo's nomination to serve as Secretary of State. The vote's outcome was uncertain until Republican Senator Rand Paul switched his vote to support Pompeo's nomination.
  • Next week, the full Senate is expected to vote in favor of Pompeo's nomination.
  • During the past 15 months, Pompeo has served as the Director of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and has become one of President Trump's close advisors. Pompeo has been deeply involved in President Trump's preparation for an upcoming summit with Kim Jong Un.
-LAxef7oFMAVoOIagO0H.foodForThought: Should Mike Pompeo be confirmed as the next Secretary of State? When is it appropriate for the Senate to block a nominee?
-LAxef7oFMAVoOIagO0H.name: Should the Senate Confirm Mike Pompeo as Secretary of State?
-LAxef7oFMAVoOIagO0H.shortTitle: Should the Senate Confirm Mike Pompeo?

-LB3kAzeMb469Jryg1iA.description:
• Over the past week, Kanye West, a rap superstar, has used social media to express some of his conservative viewpoints.
  • West tweeted his support for President Trump over Twitter and posted a picture of himself wearing a "Make America Great Again" hat signed by Donald Trump. West also announced that he shares similar viewpoints to Candace Owens, an African-American Trump supporter who regularly speaks out against the Black Lives Matter movement.
  • After posting these tweets, West received swift backlash from many other African-American celebrities.
  • This isn't the first time that West has made the news for his political views. West famously stated in 2005 that then-President George W. Bush "doesn't care about black people" in criticism of the federal government's response to Hurricane Katrina.
-LB3kAzeMb469Jryg1iA.foodForThought: Is Kanye West a courageous free-thinker, or do his views represent a betrayal of the African-American community? Is the backlash against West justified?
-LB3kAzeMb469Jryg1iA.name: Kanye West's Support of Donald Trump
-LB3kAzeMb469Jryg1iA.shortTitle: Kanye West's Support of Donald Trump

-LBJFYE5oaxxr1mikHPy.description:
• Last Friday, on April 27th, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and South Korean President Moon Jae-In met at the Peace House at Panmunjom. This marked the first inter-Korean summit in over a decade.
  • The leaders promised to work towards the "complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula." They declared an official end to the Korean War and a new era of peace.
  • North Korea has agreed to dismantle some of its nuclear test sites in May in front of experts and journalists from South Korea and the United States. North Korea also declared that it will return to a single time zone that is unified with South Korea.
  • President Trump has stated that he will likely meet with Kim Jong-un in the next three to four weeks.
-LBJFYE5oaxxr1mikHPy.foodForThought: Is the talk of an end to the Korean war realistic? How was the recent summit between North and South Korean leaders perceived by different nations?
-LBJFYE5oaxxr1mikHPy.name: An End to the Korean War?
-LBJFYE5oaxxr1mikHPy.shortTitle: An End to the Korean War?

-LBMxw-RJzyCwhe-Dx2S.description:
• Last Sunday, T-Mobile and Sprint announced a $26.5B merger deal.
  • T-Mobile's CEO, John Legere, will lead the combined company which will retain the name T-Mobile.
  • Sprint and T-Mobile say that this deal will give them the scale and resources needed to make large investments in a 5G wireless system.
  • If the deal is approved by the Justice Department and the Federal Communications Commission (FCC), the new T-Mobile could be a formidable competitor to Verizon and AT&T.
  • The two companies previously attempted to merge in 2014, but the deal was not approved by Obama-era regulators due to anti-trust concerns. It remains to be seen whether the Trump Administration will take a similar regulatory approach.
-LBMxw-RJzyCwhe-Dx2S.foodForThought: What does the proposed merger between T-Mobile and Sprint mean for consumers? For investors? Should regulators approve the deal?
-LBMxw-RJzyCwhe-Dx2S.name: Is the T-Mobile / Sprint Merger Good or Bad?

-LBTWEuN5lhnFQcVbUk3.description:
• Last weekend, comedian Michelle Wolf gave a 20-minute comedic monologue at the White House Correspondent's Dinner.
  • Her controversial set took sharp aim at many individuals, particularly President Trump, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, and Kellyanne Conway. This annual dinner always includes roasts of public figures and the media, but some claim that Wolf's jokes went too far and were inappropriate for the bi-partisan event.
  • Wolf has served as a writer and contributor for Late Night with Seth Myers, The Daily Show, and has her own HBO show, which is sarcastically called Nice Lady.
-LBTWEuN5lhnFQcVbUk3.foodForThought: Was Michelle Wolf's monologue appropriate for the dinner? When does comedy go too far?
-LBTWEuN5lhnFQcVbUk3.name: Michelle Wolf's Monologue at the White House Correspondents' Dinner

-LBYdPFOEscDAEf03rup.description:
• The Boy Scouts of America announced Wednesday that it intends to change the name of its flagship Boy Scouts program to Scouts BSA.
  • This announcement follows the Boy Scouts’ decision last October to allow girls to participate and become Scouts. 
  • The organization's changes have sparked some controversy and have strained its relationship with the Girl Scouts of America.
-LBYdPFOEscDAEf03rup.foodForThought: What is the significance of Scout BSA's recent organizational changes? Do they represent a step in the right direction, or do they threaten the tradition of the institution?
-LBYdPFOEscDAEf03rup.name: Boy Scouts drop the 'Boy'...

-LBciaLdA67VYGYCh_t_.description:
• Special Counsel Robert Mueller has some questions for President Trump. On Monday, the New York Times published a list of over 48 questions that Mueller wants to ask of President Trump.
  • The questions cover a wide range of subjects, including Michael Flynn, James Comey, Jeff Sessions, and campaign ties with Russia.
  • The New York Times says that it obtained the questions from a person outside of President Trump's legal team.
  • On Tuesday, President Trump sharply criticized the leaked questions. Negotiations are taking place to determine if President Trump will agreed to the interview.
-LBciaLdA67VYGYCh_t_.foodForThought: What does Robert Mueller know? If you were President Trump, would you take or decline the interview?
-LBciaLdA67VYGYCh_t_.name: Mueller's Questions for President Trump

-LBsTT9aRCKonm-jm7AJ.description:
• On April 24th, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) proposed a new set of rules for the agency's scientific research studies.
  • The EPA claims that its new rules will increase the organization's transparency by ensuring that the scientific information underlying any regulation is "publicly available in a manner that is sufficient for independent validation."
  • While EPA Administrator, Scott Pruitt, argues that "the era of secret science at the EPA is coming to an end," many scientists argue that the new rules could be devastating for researchers.
-LBsTT9aRCKonm-jm7AJ.foodForThought: How much data should be required to justify environmental regulations? What defines good science?
-LBsTT9aRCKonm-jm7AJ.name: The End of 'Secret Science' at the EPA?
-LBsTT9aRCKonm-jm7AJ.shortTitle: The End of 'Secret Science' at the EPA?

-LBwQzUo5Z1opT8oNk-f.description:
• Marvel's latest movie, Avengers: Infinity War, continues to smash box office records.
  • Last weekend, the film officially became the fastest ever to cross $1B mark in global box office sales. It reached $1B in a mere 11 days. The movie also scored the biggest opening weekend numbers of all-time with $250M in sales.
  • Avengers: Infinity War, is the 19th super hero film released by the Marvel franchise.
  • Not everyone is celebrating though. Legendary filmmaker, James Cameron (Titanic, Avatar) made headlines for stating, "I'm hoping we'll start getting Avenger fatigue here pretty soon."
-LBwQzUo5Z1opT8oNk-f.foodForThought: Is the commercial success of superhero movies crowding out other original films? How should movie studios balance originality and financial realities?
-LBwQzUo5Z1opT8oNk-f.name: Are Movie Audiences Feeling Superhero Fatigue?

-LC0T7-N_tZl98zMWyIV.description:
• On Tuesday, President Trump gave a speech in which he announced that the United States is pulling out of the Iranian nuclear agreement.
  • He stated that the United States will reinstate harsh sanctions against the Iranian regime and may consider even harsher penalties.
  • Other countries, including Iran, France, Germany, and Britain have stated their intention to remain in the deal.
  • For months, President Trump has stated his belief that the existing deal was "flawed." He took particular issue with 'sunset clauses' in the deal. These clauses placed limits on Iran's nuclear fuel production but expire in 2030.
-LC0T7-N_tZl98zMWyIV.foodForThought: What are the United States-based arguments for and against the Iranian nuclear deal? How are countries like Iran and Israel reacting to President Trump's decision?
-LC0T7-N_tZl98zMWyIV.name: The United States Pulls out of the Iran Deal
-LC0T7-N_tZl98zMWyIV.shortTitle: The U.S. Pulls out of the Iran Deal

-LC5gLBqyphB0U45Rj9_.description:
• Eric Schneiderman, the Attorney General of New York, abruptly resigned from office this week. His resignation came on the heels of accusations that Schneiderman had physically abused and assaulted multiple women.
  • The New Yorker first published the reports, in which four women describe disturbing acts of violence committed against them by Schneiderman during his tenure as Attorney General.
  • Schneiderman, a member of the Democratic Party, had previously been seen as a champion of women's rights. He was an important figure in the #MeToo movement, leading a lawsuit against The Weinstein Company in the wake of the accusations and public disgrace of founder Harvey Weinstein.
  • Schneiderman has denied the claims of assault.
-LC5gLBqyphB0U45Rj9_.foodForThought: How do recent revelations concerning Schneiderman affect the Democratic Party and the #MeToo movement? What is the impact of his resignation?
-LC5gLBqyphB0U45Rj9_.img_attr: Lonnie Tague, United States Department of Justice
-LC5gLBqyphB0U45Rj9_.mobile_img_attr: Lonnie Tague, United States Department of Justice
-LC5gLBqyphB0U45Rj9_.name: Schneiderman Resigns Over Abuse Allegations

-LCARUEbk4KMDkLE4uAK.description:
• This week, President Trump's foreign policy moves dominated headlines.
  • On Tuesday, President Trump made the controversial decision to pull out of the Iran nuclear deal, a deal that was viewed by some as one of former President Obama's signature accomplishments.
  • Then, Thursday at 3am, President Trump welcomed home three Americans who were detained in North Korea.
  • He also announced over Twitter that his anticipated summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will take place on June 12th in Singapore.
  • Due to these big announcements, it feels like a good time to step back and broadly assess President Trump's foreign policy to-date.
-LCARUEbk4KMDkLE4uAK.foodForThought: At this point in time, what grade would you assign to President Trump's foreign policy?
-LCARUEbk4KMDkLE4uAK.name: A Big-Picture Look at President Trump's Foreign Policy

-LCQgub0CXsvmq2Jf24l.description:
• The NBA's Eastern and Western Conference Finals kicked off on Sunday, May 13th.
  • The Eastern Conference matchup pits the Boston Celtics (55-27) against Lebron James and the Cleveland Cavaliers (50-32). The Western Conference matchup features the Houston Rockets (65-17) and the Golden State Warriors (58-24).
  • Each team has its own unique story: the Golden State Warriors are seeking their third NBA title in four years. The Houston Rockets had the best regular season in the league and want to prove themselves in the postseason. Lebron James is looking to add to his legacy by making his 8th straight NBA finals. The Boston Celtics are trying to win behind a great coach and a great supporting cast after losing two of their star players.
  • We thought it would be fun to show you what local sports columnists wrote about their respective teams. Enjoy!
-LCQgub0CXsvmq2Jf24l.foodForThought: What storylines are unique to the Cleveland, Boston, Houston and San Francisco teams? What are the strengths and weaknesses of each team?
-LCQgub0CXsvmq2Jf24l.name: The NBA Conference Finals, According to Local Sportswriters
-LCQgub0CXsvmq2Jf24l.shortTitle: Local Takes on the NBA Conference Finals

-LCTz3b1SRjHN32bDulC.description:
• Last Friday, President Trump unveiled his plan to lower prescription drug prices.
  • The plan included some broad suggestions that could give the government better leverage when negotiating with pharmaceutical companies.
  • It also suggested that the United States should pressure other nations to raise their prescription drug prices, because, according to President Trump and many pharmaceutical companies, these countries are "free-riding" off of American innovation.
  • In addition, President Trump said he might require pharmaceutical companies to reveal a drug's price in advertisements, he wants to ban gag-clauses for pharmacists, and he wants to make it tougher for companies to use loopholes to hold onto patent protections.
-LCTz3b1SRjHN32bDulC.foodForThought: What are the strengths and weaknesses of President Trump's plan to lower drug prices?
-LCTz3b1SRjHN32bDulC.name: President Trump's Plan to Lower Drug Prices
-LCTz3b1SRjHN32bDulC.shortTitle: Trump's Plan to Lower Drug Prices

-LC_qI6GybwmGboiyw0y.description:
• This past Monday, the United States officially moved its embassy from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.
  • On the day of the controversial embassy move, tens of thousands of Palestinians assembled in protest, with reports of some attempting to cross the Gaza border fence.
  • The Israeli army claims that these Palestinian protesters were throwing firebombs and explosive devices at the security fence and at Israeli troops.
  • The Israeli Defense Forces opened fire on the protesters, killing nearly 60 protesters and injuring thousands.
  • This was the bloodiest day for Palestinians since 2014. The U.S. White House and Israel blame Gaza's ruling Hamas group for the violent protests and argue that Israel has a right to defend its border.
-LC_qI6GybwmGboiyw0y.foodForThought: What roles did the United States, Palestine, Hamas and Israel play in the tragic events? What is the best path forward now?
-LC_qI6GybwmGboiyw0y.name: Violence at the Gaza Border

-LCeoPB2V8X9MdI7FHZe.description:
• On Monday, the Supreme Court issued a landmark ruling, Murphy v. NCAA, that gives states the ability to legalize sports gambling.
  • Prior to this decision, the 1992 Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA) had effectively outlawed sports gambling nation-wide.
  • The PASPA did make a few exceptions, including the states of Nevada, Oregon, Delaware and Montana, and did not apply to a few events like horse and dog racing.
  • The Court's 6-3 decision ruled that PAPSA violated the 10th amendment because the U.S. constitution grants states all rights that aren't explicitly granted to the federal government, including sports gambling.
-LCeoPB2V8X9MdI7FHZe.foodForThought: Do you think the Supreme Court made the right decision? Do you think sports gambling is a good or bad idea?
-LCeoPB2V8X9MdI7FHZe.name: Is the Sports Gambling Ruling Good or Bad?
-LCeoPB2V8X9MdI7FHZe.shortTitle: Is Sports Gambling Ruling Good or Bad?

-LCk6nAGdEukJ1ZytemQ.description:
• This Saturday, Prince Harry will wed American actress Meghan Markle at Windsor Castle in England.
  • There has been a substantial amount of international media coverage of all aspects of the upcoming royal wedding, and millions are expected to view Saturday's wedding ceremonies.
  • The traditions of British royal weddings have long been the subject of fascination and celebration for many around the world.
  • Saturday's royal wedding will undoubtedly elicit comparisons to past British royal weddings, many of which garnered similar public appeal and international coverage.
-LCk6nAGdEukJ1ZytemQ.foodForThought: Why does a British royal wedding always garner so much attention? Will you tune in?
-LCk6nAGdEukJ1ZytemQ.name: The Royal Wedding Hoopla...

-LCz2zwve2ZAN7pMQqBU.description:
• On Friday morning, a 17-year-old student opened fire on his fellow classmates and teachers, killing ten people and injuring at least ten others. The deadly school shooting occurred at Santa Fe High School, located outside of Houston, Texas.
  • The gunman, who attended the school, has been identified as Dimitrios Pagourtzis. Pagourtzis was armed with a pistol and a shotgun, and eventually surrendered to police officers about thirty minutes after the massacre began. Police said they also found explosive devices within the school.
  • The tragedy in Texas marks the 16th school shooting to occur at an elementary, middle, or high school in the United States so far in 2018. 
  • President Trump condemned the attack, stating: “This has been going on too long in our country-- too many years, too many decades now… We grieve for the terrible loss of life and send our support and love to everyone affected by this absolutely horrific attack.”
